data.title: Domain Migration UDP GCP Full Migration
data.description: Objective : Modernize the current EDIS platform and migrate all IT or Business owned data, Data Models, Reports, API, Data Science models from current EDIS EDM to GCP BigQuery as a Unified Data Platform. Outcomes : EDIS Modernization Re architect and implement current EDIS functionality on Google Cloud Platform using Datametica s metadata and configuration driven DIF and other tools e.g., Confluent connector, DataFlow, Pub Sub, IBM IDR for CDC EDM Migration Implement EDM Ingress to Snowflake tables from ALL sources including BODs and Non BOD interfaces like ADF, API on BigQuery. All objects like tables and views will be backward compatible to work with existing reports and applications. In addition, this migration will include: Reports PowerBI, Thoughspot, Crystal Reports Business managed schema aka BizOps APIs to connect to BQ 3 rd party data feeds inbound, outbound Data Science Models Data Share Data will be made available back to Snowflake

data.title: Kaleris Power BI Reports
data.description: Automating the Kaleris Power BI reports to help Corp Traffic with manually creating the yard reports. Kaliers Enterprise Visibility Suite EVS provides Albertsons with a consolidated view of operations across all its yard sites running the Kaleris YMS. It delivers single pane visibility into their accessorial charge management, inbound processing, and assets such as trailers, providing KPIs to support exception management to generate the best outcomes across the network. Corporate and on site teams are empowered to proactively work together to address areas that require attention, such as better management of network yard capacity or validating trailer pool location and size.

Insider Threat Program
data.description: Develop and operationalize a world class Insider Threat Management Program to increase detection of insider threat indicators, assess risk, and communicate threat information to stakeholders to fulfill the following core functions: Deter potential insider attacks by instituting policies, security controls, procedures, and programs to protect the organization Detect threatening or concerning behaviors and identify individuals at risk of committing an insider attack, whether wittingly or unwittingly Communicate risk and threat information to stakeholders to mitigate threats before they escalate to violence, espionage, sabotage, or theft Prevent violence and hostile acts from occurring

Data Loss Prevention
data.description: Data Loss Prevention is the InfoSec Service that identifies and protects against the mishandling, misuse, misconfiguration, and or exfiltration of data contained in our cloud and on prem environments and facilitate operational processes for monitoring, mitigating, and responding to improper or unsanctioned activity on sensitive data.

data.title: Fraud Prevention
data.description: The InfoSec Fraud Prevention service focuses on identifying processes and workflows in customer, vendor, and internal business activities that may be leveraged maliciously and pose financial losses to the organization. The focus is to develop inter departmental collaboration between eCommerce, Asset Protection, and InfoSec to develop technical and process safeguards to deter and or block fraudulent events while facilitating legitimate activities to continue.

data.title: Application Security
data.description: Application Security are the practices and capabilities that support a secure development lifecycle. It drives improved secure coding awareness in the development community, creates capabilities that streamline security in the SDLC, and drive a shift left for Information Security.

data.title: Vulnerability Management
data.description: Vulnerability Management is a broad set of practices and capabilities that support broad attack surface hygiene, help prioritize remediation activities, and provide long term data trends on vulnerability landscape and exposure.

You can add information prescriptions into the EPR as well as the Patient. Optum can also receive an ORTF file and create an PAF file to insert the patient into the EPR.

data.title: Gen AI Pharmacy, Health
data.description: Objectives: Developing a natural language AI system for our IVR to facilitate vaccine appointments through a telephone interface is crucial in enhancing accessibility and efficiency. This solution aims to alleviate the burden on healthcare providers and empower patients, especially those with limited digital access. By employing advanced natural language processing, the AI can understand and respond to users scheduling needs, offering a seamless and user friendly experience. This technology not only streamlines the appointment process but also contributes to the broader goal of increasing vaccination rates and promoting public health. Enable outbound phone calls for notifying patients about vaccine availability adds a proactive dimension to healthcare outreach. By leveraging this capability, the system can efficiently inform individuals when vaccines become accessible, ensuring timely updates and increasing vaccination awareness. This approach fosters a more inclusive and responsive healthcare system, reaching out to patients who might not actively seek information. Experiment with a natural language Ai to assist with transfer phone calls, on average our stores have to manually call on 400K inbound transfers each year, shifting this to an automated process for associate.

data.title: Manage OTC on hands via POS transaction
data.description: Objective: Enhance the user friendlies of our pharmacy system to support our frontline in delivering a seamless patient experience. Problem Statement: Everyday our Pharmacy Associates deal with trying to maintain inventory of items they keep on hand for customers that don t require a prescription. For many of these items the inventory is only maintained by the pharmacy staff. Introducing a new system for the pharmacy staff to be able to maintain those levels and automatically track that inventory electronically would save pharmacy associates x time every week and improve in stock from X to Y help keep quantities on hand for customers to purchase when needed. Aim to pilot in Q4 24 pending dependencies.

data.title: PG00006 B2B Modernization Redesign
data.description: FOR: Internal and External vendors, EDI and B2B Platform teams WHO: Wants to provide seamless services of processing data files to support our business processes. THIS: B2B Modernization Redesign IS A: Program THAT: Provides a stable platform to process B2B transactions and events and making it easy for teams to identify impediments and resolve them in timely manner. UNLIKE: today platforms are unstable and lack visibility to identify root cause and cycle burn for team supporting OUR INITIATIVE: Provide new architecture to process including Sterling 1.5 SFT , Axway B2Bi MFT . Transaction Monitoring Value Metrics Platform Monitoring Alerting BUSINESS OUTCOMES: Reduction of events outages impacting our customers

data.title: AS26818 Axway MFT Tool
data.description: FOR: B2B Platform Team, MFT Customers WHO: want to transfer files to and from partner and vendors including requirements for divestment THIS: Axway MFT Tool IS A: Asset THAT: Refresh our Axway platform as current the Axway version is end of extended support end of June. UNLIKE: Today, where we are at risk of support of a mission critical application. OUR INITIATIVE: Provide new Axway B2Bi as one option to transfer MFT files. BUSINESS OUTCOMES: List OKRS or benefits hypothesis that will be translated into Features REQUESTOR NAME: Carina Reyes CONTACT: Carina.Reyes albertsons.com

data.title: AS26819 Sterling SFT Tool
data.description: FOR: B2B Platform Team WHO: Wants to simplify the B2B architecture to improve stability, scalability, resiliency, security so that team can best support our customers with the team we have. THIS: Sterling SFT Tool IS A: ASSET THAT: Is built on VM instead of container from scratch with simpler architectures and components to provide stability, scalability, resiliency and security so that we can manage the platform better. UNLIKE: Today, where Sterling is built on OCP that is causing POD restart causing delay or missing files for process, disrupting our business and demand high level of manual labor to get the systems back to normal processing. OUR INITIATIVE: A brand newly build platform based on VM with out of the box configuration to simplify our architecture that is easy for us to operate, identify issues early on. BUSINESS OUTCOMES: 24X7 B2B transaction processing. If issues arise, we leverage our reports and monitoring capability to recover operations with the SLA to avoid disruption. REQUESTOR NAME: Carina Reyes CONTACT: Carina. Reyes albertsons.com

data.title: AS26490 Network Connectivity Automation

data.title: DivestCo Distribution Center s DC s
Growthloop MARVE Generative AI
data.description: 1. User Story As a... I want to... So that... As a Business User, Marketer, or Marketing Operations User, I want to use natural language prompts to describe and generate customer journeys and audience segments within Growthloop CDP, powered by MARVE Generative AI, So that I can significantly reduce the time and technical expertise required to create targeted campaigns, iterate faster, and unlock more sophisticated personalization strategies. 2. Problem Statement: Currently, creating complex customer journeys and nuanced audience segments in Growthloop CDP is a manual, time consuming process that often requires deep technical understanding of the platform s rule builder and data model. This can be a bottleneck for marketers, slowing down campaign ideation and execution, and limiting the ability to quickly test new hypotheses. Non technical users may find it challenging to leverage the full power of the CDP. 3. Proposed Solution: Integrate MARVE Generative AI into Growthloop CDP to provide a new interface where users can describe their desired customer journeys and audience segments using natural language. MARVE will interpret these descriptions and automatically generate the corresponding configurations rules, steps, conditions, etc. within Growthloop, ready for review, refinement, and activation. This involves: Developing an interface for users to input natural language prompts. Integrating with MARVE Generative AI API. MARVE s NLP engine processing the input and understanding user intent. MARVE generating structured journey audience definitions compatible with Growthloop s architecture. Presenting the generated journey audience to the user for review and editing within the existing Growthloop UI. Ensuring MARVE is aware of the Growthloop data schema attributes, events, etc. to accurately map user intent. 4. Key Capabilities Features: NLP Input Interface: A dedicated area e.g., a text box or modal within Growthloop for users to type their journey or audience descriptions in plain English. Audience Generation via NLP: Ability to define audience criteria based on attributes, events, behaviors, and their combinations using natural language e.g., Users who live in New York, purchased product X in the last 30 days, and opened our last newsletter . MARVE translates this into Growthloop specific segmentation rules. Journey Generation via NLP: Ability to outline journey steps, triggers, conditions, delays, and actions using natural language e.g., When a user signs up, send them a welcome email. If they click a link in the email, add them to the engaged segment. If not, after 3 days, send a follow up email with a special offer. . MARVE translates this into a Growthloop journey flow. Review and Edit Mechanism: Users can view the MARVE generated audience rules or journey flow in the standard Growthloop interface and make manual adjustments before saving or activating. Contextual Awareness Data Schema : MARVE needs to be aware of available customer attributes, events, and segment names within the specific Growthloop instance to accurately interpret prompts. Disambiguation Clarification Stretch Goal for MVP : If a prompt is ambiguous, MARVE ideally should ask clarifying questions or present potential interpretations. 5. Acceptance Criteria AC : General: AC1: The MARVE AI integration is secure and complies with data privacy policies. AC2: The new NLP input interface is intuitive and clearly discoverable within Growthloop CDP. AC3: MARVE s responses and generations are reasonably fast e.g., within X seconds for typical queries . AC4: Clear error handling and user guidance are provided if MARVE cannot understand a prompt or if an error occurs during generation. Audience Generation: AC5: Given a Growth Marketer, when they input a clear natural language description for an audience e.g., Customers who made a purchase over 100 in the last 60 days and live in California , then MARVE accurately generates the corresponding segment rules in Growthloop, ready for review. AC6: Given a generated audience, when the user reviews it, then they can modify the rules using the existing Growthloop segmentation UI and save it. AC7: MARVE correctly interprets common operators AND, OR, NOT , date ranges, numerical comparisons, and string matches for attributes. Journey Generation: AC8: Given a Growth Marketer, when they input a clear natural language description for a multi step journey e.g., On user registration, send welcome email. Wait 2 days. If no purchase, send offer email. If purchase, add to VIP segment. , then MARVE accurately generates the corresponding journey flow with triggers, actions, delays, and conditions in Growthloop, ready for review. AC9: Given a generated journey, when the user reviews it, then they can modify steps, conditions, and actions using the existing Growthloop journey builder UI and save it. AC10: MARVE can generate journeys based on triggers e.g., when a user abandons cart , actions e.g., send email X, add to list Y , conditions e.g., if user is in segment Z , and delays e.g., wait 3 days . Adoption Usability: AC11: Documentation and in app guidance are available for using the MARVE NLP feature. AC12: Users are able to successfully create and activate at least one audience and one journey using the MARVE feature during UAT. 6. Out of Scope for this initial feature MVP : Full conversational, back and forth dialogue with MARVE beyond simple clarifications if implemented . MARVE generating creative content e.g., email copy, SMS text . This feature focuses on structural generation. Proactive suggestions from MARVE without user prompts. Automatic optimization of MARVE generated or any journeys audiences based on performance data. MARVE learning and adapting its generation style based on individual user feedback beyond global model improvements . 7. Dependencies: Stable and documented MARVE Generative AI API. Access to and understanding of Growthloop CDP s internal data model and API for creating modifying audiences and journeys. Infrastructure to host manage the interaction with MARVE if not fully cloud based . Clear definition of customer attributes and events within Growthloop that MARVE needs to be aware of. 8. Success Metrics How we ll measure impact : Adoption Rate: of active Growthloop users utilizing the MARVE NLP feature within X months post launch. Time to Create: Reduction in average time taken to create a new audience or journey compared to the manual method. Volume of Creation: Number of audiences and journeys created via MARVE. User Satisfaction: CSAT NPS scores from users specifically surveyed about this feature. Error Rate Refinement Needed: Percentage of MARVE generated items that require significant manual correction vs. minor tweaks or direct use. Increased Campaign Velocity: Number of new campaigns tests launched that leverage MARVE generated assets.

data.title: UMA Round Up Donations
data.description: All the details in here https: rxsafeway my.sharepoint.com personal dbhan01 safeway com layouts 15 doc.aspx sourcedoc b086dd7f 80bd 403f bc85 432d58f6b538 action edit https: rxsafeway my.sharepoint.com personal dbhan01 safeway com layouts 15 doc.aspx sourcedoc b086dd7f 80bd 403f bc85 432d58f6b538 amp action edit Goal : Complement the broader corporate giving efforts by creating an ability to donate while placing online orders. Currently Available : Nothing. We just have BPNs for set amount but lot of work is needed to mobilize this. Potential solution : Round up the total option at checkout Requirement : Customer will be presented an option checkbox to round up their order total similar to gifting Round up for charity subtext Donate 0.35 to nourishing neighbors to fight against hunger If they choose to round up, we use the exact amount stated at the time of order placement as the donation amount even if the order total later changes due to reasons like oos, substitutions etc. Order edit will be out of scope. There will not be any option to change donation amount, or donate at the time of editing the order This is ONLY applicable for B2C orders Assumptions: We will create a Standard Donation PLU with variable price option similar to driver tipping This does not need to go to accupick Donations will be refundable similar to driver tipping Order payload will have this as one more line item when it sends out the information so it can be handled downstream like driver tipping . Nourishing neighbors will be the same name across all banners. Small 1 4 sprints Medium: 4 8 Large 8 16: XL 16 Only orders that are fully paid via CC, apple pay, paypal, and banner cash will have this enabled. This will be restricted from UI at the cart and checkout itself This will show up on receipt This will also show up on all order communications

FY25 Account Identity Opex
data.description: opportunity Build a contextual widget to collect explicit customer information preferences, interests, and identity , and that is easy plugin across pages ex: celebration page and configurable by info we need ex: birthday . The information collected feeds into an evolved account dashboard, Me space, that lets customers confidently and securely manage their relationship with ACI, and activates personalization, monetization, and loyalty across the experiences. The Me space lets households control and maximize their membership with Albertsons. Concurrently, we ll expand security measures within our platform by enabling passkeys, MFA and new forms of verification for sign in and specific actions ex: add a new delivery address Our scope: In FY24, Identity new registration flow, self service tools, and profile completion with reward incentives resulted in addition of 2.9M vs 2.3M FY24 target customers with both email phone info on base of 25M, 1.4M reachable vs 1.05M FY24 target on base of 28M, 0.18M full names and 0.57M birthdays. This identity completion for birthday increased the reachability of personalization experiment that resulted in 0.17 in revenue, 4.14 clip and 4.54 in b day coupon redemption rate. The FY24 areas focused on redesigning our registration flow to enable customer self service more pieces of info both email phone, name , progressive profile to ask additional pieces of info ex: diets, birthdays, address etc. , and self service tools for householding add, remove members, manage subscriptions in a new utilitarian member tab. Though our efforts reaped positive business benefits and customer benefits, we learned that to further scale these efforts for identity collection, we need to be contextual, create components that are easy to plug in integrate across pages, and dynamic to collect missing profile attributes to know our customers at a deeper level. At the core, we need to evolve our static account dashboard to translate into a Me space that brings the customer to the center of everything serving as a launchpad to manage preferences, subscriptions, favorite recipes, and pick up where they left off. Moreover, our platforms continue to face challenges on Account Takeover 1000 known cases in FY24 bot attacks which needs our security to be further strengthened across all levels. In FY25, we will approach the above in the following manner: Build a platform with contextual easy plug in widgets that collects explicit customer preferences diet, interest occasions, etc., Create a ME platform that has unified, centralized and secure access to all preferences, tools and settings. For ex: dietary. preferences across grocery, meals and health would be centralized in account through C360 Enhance security verification methods with MFA and build robust infrastructure for vendor platforms. Strengthen platform security to identify recycled phone numbers 500K month and validate customer information periodically. 27175 Digital Catalog Image Generation Platform
data.description: As part of the overarching Fresh category excellence initiative led by the merchandising teams, we are setting up a platform to generate images at scale which was currently done through vendor platforms costing 150 per image 15M annually . This platform will be used to generate lifestyle images for product listings and imagery across various aspects such as Marketing, Own Brands, and Merchandising on our online grocery platform. By leveraging these technologies, we aim to enhance visual appeal, improve customer engagement, and achieve significant cost savings compared to traditional studio photography. We will introduce a review approval process of images generated ensuring that there are no duplicative images on 1P UMA. As part of the Omni channel Fresh category excellence initiative, we are building a platform to generate and elevate alternate imagery for our own brand items and fresh category items. We are expecting savings of 15M in pure profitability.This initiative aims to enhance visual appeal and customer engagement by ensuring our product listings are more attractive and consistent, ultimately improving the shopping experience.

data.title: 27169 Digital Catalog Multihoming Taxonomy
data.description: h3. Original: Background Today, customers struggle to efficiently navigate our product catalog due to a rigid taxonomy that limits products to single categories, making it difficult to find what they need. To address this, we will develop a flexible taxonomy that supports multi homing, allowing products to be categorized under multiple relevant categories. By leveraging AI for evaluation and creating self service tools for stakeholders, we expect to enhance product discoverability and streamline the shopping experience, ultimately increasing customer satisfaction and driving sales. Expected to drive 25 50M in incremental sales. Problem statement: Our taxonomy is confusing difficult to navigate, which can impact the customer experience in several ways: Difficulty finding products: Our current taxonomy system presents challenges that impede our ability to efficiently categorize and manage products. When categories are not logically organized, customers may struggle to find the products they are looking for. Poor User Experience: A cluttered or confusing navigation structure can make the shopping experience cumbersome, reducing the likelihood of customers returning to the site Reduced Search Efficiency: Ineffective taxonomy can hinder the site s search functionality, making it harder for customers to get relevant search results quickly. Lower Conversion Rates: If customers cannot easily find what they need, they are less likely to make a purchase, which can negatively impact sales and conversion rates. Opportunity: The lack of multi homing capabilities restrict products to a single category. This limitation affects both 1P and marketplace products, leading to inefficiencies in product discovery and a suboptimal search and browse experience. Managing taxonomy changes currently depends on catalog operations teams. Stakeholders lack the tools to make necessary adjustments independently, which slows down our response to market needs. Taxonomy shelf URLs are generated only when a product is available in a default store. If a product is not in a default store, the Taxonomy URL is not assigned to the new taxonomy in the left navigation. Consequently, the product can only be found through search, not via the left navigation. As a customer, I can efficiently find products under multiple categories. As a user of Catalog UI, I am able to create new nodes and self serve on new taxonomy needed for events occassions

data.title: 27219 Dynamic Budget Optimization Engine
data.description: Enterprise Priority: Value, Pricing Margin Dynamic Budget Optimization Engine is a centralized system to help budget conscious shoppers maximize value and stay on track by coordinating all their planning outputs in a single place, which will enable connected experiences across ACI, boost engagement, retention and revenue. This centralized engine will also enable other feature owners to consume our APIs to bring individual components within the digital system to life in their particular use case. For example, the Shops team can leverage our API to incorporate the Budget Tracker feature within our system into their particular Shop in Shop. The Dynamic Budget Optimization Engine Build: 1 Value engine that ingests a budget set by the customer and enables personalized recommendations , including: a My Budget captures weekly spend, tracks budget and of items and meals shopped 2 Data feeding value engine includes: a Budget set by customer for the week from 1a b Planned meals recipes bundles that are ready to be cooked c Optional calendar data to enable meals to be organized by day of week d Current shopping lists and or cart yet to be shopped e My Recipes imported scanned f Favorited Recipes g Cook It Again previously shopped recipes h Food Assistant plans i BIA data your staples 3 Once the engine consumes data from part 2, consolidated, personalized outputs from planning tools will enable recommendations to keep customers on track with their plan, including: a Cart builder to reach the customer s desired budget b Recommends top discounted recipes and bundles and ultimately, fixed price points , highlighting discounts, and provides clear insights into spending targets

data.title: 27041 Digital Catalog Limited Time Offer Pre order
data.description: This software will help us provide a seamless, convenient, and efficient pre order experience for customers, enabling them to secure limited edition and high demand products effortlessly through both digital channels and in store interactions. This omnichannel pre order capability ensures customer satisfaction, optimizes item and inventory management, and drives business growth. New Capabilities 1. Pre Order Item Manager This capability will extend the current item set up capabilities in digital catalog to support pre orderable products. The following item level attributes will be added a. Pre Order Active Inactive b. Schedule Start and End Date c. Quantity Limits existing capability total or per day d. Estimated Ship datescus e. Pre Order badges or icon f. Pre Order Descriptions or T Cs g. Override capability on inventory settings e.g., Force Pre order, Hide Inventory left message 2. Pre Order Inventory Management a. Total Inventory allocated to Ecom b. Total Inventory Left helps create the scarcity message only X left . Real time synchronization of pre order data with inventory management system to ensure accurate tracking and reservation of stock before product hits the shelves. c. Business logic to keep Pre Order inventory up to date 3. Customer Experience on UMA web a. Updates to Product Cards, PDP and Cart pages to display Preorder icon, Call to Action button, Product release date and Fulfillment date. 4. Pre Order Fulfillment Manager a. Pre Order slot logic Updates to slot logic for handling pre orders based on pre defined fulfillment windows for DUG Delivery. During checkout, customers will see the available slots withing the defined window. It will also handle the case for mixed items where a customer is checking out with Pre Order and immediately available items. b. Inventory reservation Integration into AcuPick for one time notification for reserving the inventory at stores and putting them at a designated location. c. Delivery DUG fees adjustments for Pre Orders DUG fees will be waived but Delivery fees will apply. 5. AcuPick updates for Pre order a. Pre Order picks AcuPick to direct associates to the designated place where inventory for pre ordered products is reserved. b. Notifications Trigger notification APIs after product is delivered to the customer pick up area inside the store. Customers will be notified that their pre order products are ready to be picked up inside the store at a defined place explore in Phase 2

data.title: Historicals Do Not Use for FY25 Customer Account and identity CAM
data.description: opportunity Build a contextual widget to collect explicit customer information preferences, interests, and identity , and that is easy plugin across pages ex: celebration page and configurable by info we need ex: birthday . The information collected feeds into an evolved account dashboard, Me space, that lets customers confidently and securely manage their relationship with ACI, and activates personalization, monetization, and loyalty across the experiences. The Me space lets households control and maximize their membership with Albertsons. Concurrently, we ll expand security measures within our platform by enabling passkeys, MFA and new forms of verification for sign in and specific actions ex: add a new delivery address Our scope: In FY24, Identity new registration flow, self service tools, and profile completion with reward incentives resulted in addition of 2.9M vs 2.3M FY24 target customers with both email phone info on base of 25M, 1.4M reachable vs 1.05M FY24 target on base of 28M, 0.18M full names and 0.57M birthdays. This identity completion for birthday increased the reachability of personalization experiment that resulted in 0.17 in revenue, 4.14 clip and 4.54 in b day coupon redemption rate. The FY24 areas focused on redesigning our registration flow to enable customer self service more pieces of info both email phone, name , progressive profile to ask additional pieces of info ex: diets, birthdays, address etc. , and self service tools for householding add, remove members, manage subscriptions in a new utilitarian member tab. Though our efforts reaped positive business benefits and customer benefits, we learned that to further scale these efforts for identity collection, we need to be contextual, create components that are easy to plug in integrate across pages, and dynamic to collect missing profile attributes to know our customers at a deeper level. At the core, we need to evolve our static account dashboard to translate into a Me space that brings the customer to the center of everything serving as a launchpad to manage preferences, subscriptions, favorite recipes, and pick up where they left off. Moreover, our platforms continue to face challenges on Account Takeover 1000 known cases in FY24 bot attacks which needs our security to be further strengthened across all levels. In FY25, we will approach the above in the following manner: Build a platform with contextual easy plug in widgets that collects explicit customer preferences diet, interest occasions, etc., Create a ME platform that has unified, centralized and secure access to all preferences, tools and settings. For ex: dietary. preferences across grocery, meals and health would be centralized in account through C360 Enhance security verification methods with MFA and build robust infrastructure for vendor platforms. Strengthen platform security to identify recycled phone numbers 500K month and validate customer information periodically. data.title: Health Wellness Pharmacy Avia Platform Modernization
data.description: Avia is a prescription benefit provider company owned by Albertsons. https: www.aviapartners.com Today the platform for managing this offering is Snowflake and Microsoft Access based and we want to migrate to GCP. We are looking to migrate the data from Azure Snowflake to GCP Google Cloud Platform . In this new platform the intent is to have more reliable data management tools Future State in place and move away from Access. Current state Access requires constant updating to its existing macros for reporting and queries and has been known to break from time to time. This causes delays in our daily process because someone needs to trace the error and then repair it. This also gives us a chance to move and consolidate all data off local computers and network drives. where we lost most of our data earlier this year, with no tracking to know how it happened There is currently a desktop being used for automation that will probably be eliminated when this task has been completed. The desktop local machines in use represent a high risk point of failure. Moving the data and functionality to the cloud should highly reduce if not eliminate the risk of failure, and potential waste of employee work effort hours when there are issues. Current work effort is collaborating with internal and contracted resources to capture and verify what the current state is and document it as best we can. Next steps will need to be a process to identify what the future state will be and what tools Software, Power BI, etc. will be utilized. Another intent of the future state will be to identify what processes and activities can be safely automated.

data.title: Health Wellness Pharmacy Journey Orchestration
data.description: h1. Introduction and Background Sincerely Health launched to Albertsons customers in February 2023 with 1.45M registered customers to date Aug 15, 24 . Despite strong initial customer acquisition, the majority of platform engagement centers on Digital Pharmacy 67 of customers and only 33 of customers engaging with health and wellness related features. Through FY23, SH platform engagement MAU was 40 , signaling opportunities to increase engagement across key platform segments and features. Health Score Wheel of Life 85 of customers completed the survey . Only 2 of customers engage with health score after completing the survey. Health Goals 36 of customers created at least one goal and 50 of goals are completed. News Offers Only 8 engaged with news and offers. Notifications Only 6 engaged with notifications Connected devices 41 of customers have connected a tracker. Today, a deeply engaged Sincerely Health customer receives an experience similar to a minimally engaged customer. The static nature of the current health homepage does not promote or encourage customers to discover and engage with new features or tie customer journeys together in logical and intuitive ways.Customers must self navigate and discover content with only occasional prompts, alerts, or nudges resulting in an experience that is disconnected. As more digital tools, features, and external partners are integrated into the Sincerely Health ecosystem, we have an obligation to support broader and deeper platform engagement amongst new and existing customers so they may optimize the full value of Sincerely Health. Goal The Sincerely Health homepage is a welcoming point for new customers and a starting point for returning customers to resume their health journeys. Our strategy for the homepage is to intuitively guide customers on their journey to better health by delivering a concierge experience that evolves with every touchpoint through dynamic understanding of a customer s interests, behaviors, and motivations . We believe the Health Homepage is the guiding path to help the customer simplify their health journey through simple insights, actions, and next steps . The goal with the new homepage is to increase and drive routine customer engagement defined as weekly and monthly active usage across each of Sincerely Health s core pillars 1 Nutrition 2 Activity 3 Wellness 4 Rewards. Acceptance: We need to ensure the data is enabled for Data science team to accomplish next best action in Data bricks HDL being the single source of truth https: confluence.safeway.com x VDT0F

data.title: 27102 In store Associate App
data.description: A new mobile application built from scratch for 270,000 in store associates that unifies all their needs in a single experience, tied to Albertsons systems with a single sign on access. The app will include in app features that help associates serve in store customers better, be more efficient with everyday tasks, manage their benefits and career path, and engage with both their peers and the corporation. The software will build new user experiences and services using REST GraphQL end points to connect to Scheduler, HR systems, MyACI, Retail cockpit, Sharepoint and social platforms. h2. MLP Goal Our dedicated Unified Associate App will provide a way to easily communicate and get access to the tools, resources, learning, and community building our associates need to feel connected Our Unified Associates App will help associates: Work more efficiently and effectively: FOSTER WINNING TEAMS Singular on the go access to and newly streamlined tools and resources significantly reduces time spent navigating tools and free up associates to be more productive and provide service to customers. Manage, upskill, and grow their careers along with us: STRENGTHEN FUTURES Learning transparency and accessibility not only ensures our associates are compliant and equipped in their role, but help them cross train, upskill, and have ownership over their career trajectory. Engage with Albertsons community beyond their role: BUILD COMMUNITY Create ways for the team to build relationships with each other and with our customers. Transparent company communication helps associates understand how they add value, driving purpose and career satisfaction. Feel equipped from the moment they are hired and have more time to better serve our customers: BE WELCOMING Onboarding tasks and communication for associates will help them to feel welcomed, and confidant in their work, from their very first day Our customers will receive better quality and service from our happier, more equipped associates. Recognized and rewarded for their contributions to team, store, and company: GIVE RECOGNITION Reinforce the value the frontline teams add through positive recognition that is meaningful to the individual. https: confluence.safeway.com display DMH Associate Mobile App Product Management Space

data.title: 26977 Marketplace PDP improvements
data.description: In this evolving post MLP digital expereince of third part seller marketplace eco system, customers often face challenges in discovering and learning about products offered by sellers. This is primarily due to the lack of dedicated product display pages that provide comprehensive information about these products. The problem is further compounded when customers seek to find relevant complementary products to enhance their purchase experience. Our solution to this problem is the creation of specific wall garden Product display pages for Marketplace. These pages will serve as a dedicated platform for each product, providing customers with detailed information about the product, its features, benefits, and usage. This will not only enhance the customer s understanding of the product but also foster a sense of trust and confidence in the product and the third party sellers. Additionally, these Product display pages PDPs will also feature relevant complementary products. This feature will enable customers to discover products that enhance the value and utility of their primary purchase. For instance, a customer looking at a grocery chopping board might find recommendations for knives, storage containers, or salad serving bowls. This not only enriches the customer s shopping experience but also increases the chances of additional sales for the third party sellers ACI. In essence, the creation of these wall garden Product display pages PDPs in our ACI Marketplace will solve two significant customer problems. First, it will enhance product discovery and knowledge, enabling customers to make informed purchase decisions. Second, it will facilitate the discovery of relevant complementary products, enhancing the overall value of their purchase.

data.title: 26976 Marketplace Intelligent Pricing and Deals
data.description: The automated pricing and deals service is a system designed to streamline and optimize the pricing and deal offering process in our ACI digital marketplace. It uses advanced algorithms and real time data analysis to let sellers dynamically adjust prices for each SKU based on various factors such as supply, demand, and market trends pricing across multiple sellers . This ensures that their sellers prices are always competitive and in line with the market dynamics image competitors . The service also intelligently highlights the best deals to customers based on their preferences and shopping behavior, thereby enhancing their shopping experience, and saving their time. In addition to dynamic pricing, the service also automates deal optimization. It analyzes product past pricing history, sales data, and customer behavior for each SKU to determine the optimal discount and the right time to offer it. This not only maximizes the seller s sales profits but also ensures that customers get the best deals. By automating these complex processes, the service significantly enhances the efficiency and profitability of our marketplace. It creates a win win situation for both customers and sellers, leading to a more equitable, efficient, and profitable marketplace. This comprehensive solution plays a crucial role in shaping the future of large scaled digital commerce by ACI.

data.title: 26936 Marketplace Shipping as a Channel
data.description: ACI aims to expand its existing digital services by introducing nationwide direct to home shipping for groceries and related products via trusted third party sellers. In order to create this platform service, ACI needs to create a seamless digital solution that enables customers across the US to order groceries online and have them shipped directly to their homes via third party sellers, while providing customers the information about their shipping schedules and carriers e.g.: the package be shipped via UPS will arrive at your doorstep on 4 1 2024, your package is shipped out or delayed, etc. . The solution will cover the entire process, from enabling customers to browse a new catalog of products that are available for Shipping including but not limited to selection management including pricing, inventory, deals, traffic management etc. , allow customers to place orders for nationwide shipping allow order management by sellers , while ensuring a positive user customer experience by integrating into Third party logistics 3PL service providers for seamless logistics shipping information e.g.: UPS, USPS, FedEx . Link to some visuals: https: rxsafeway my.sharepoint.com :w: g personal smalh06 safeway com EfGHzGZBKltIkdVw5DMRJcwBRvikE04vS1cgmdohW3 kgA e UFoqsK Nationwide shipping as a fulfillment channel direct to home shipping will enable ACI to reach customers who prefer the convenience of online shopping and service them beyond the boundaries of our store boundaries and inventory . Market landscape: all major image competitor perspective, including Walmart, Target, Kroger, Amazon offer this seamless shipping as a fulfilment channel as a differentiator to their customers. During recent surveys of ACI customers, we have heard from customers that they are exploring similar services as well. Shipping as a new fulfillment channel complements our existing digital ecosystem and enhances our omnichannel capabilities as a grocer in the 160B market according to Statista . Shipping as a channel asset enables ACI customers to clearly see all available fulfillment options including shipping, thus communicating 300K additional products available outside of store catalog and gives customers a choice to receive items from broader catalog directly to their doors. This additional flexibility enhances overall Customer expereince and drives Customer acquisition and retention of customers whose needs are met uniquely by shipping.

data.title: 26926 Digital Catalog Floral Selection and Inventory Mgmt
data.description: Background and Problem Statement: Goal of In Store Parity ISP program is to make all products sold to customers in store are made available to eCom customers. Background and Problem Statement: ACI stores today sell about 1B per year in floral assortment to in store customers. ACI eCom Floral business is below 10M per year and thus not in relative parity with in store business. Main reasons for the this disparity is high out of stock rate about 50 and not presenting the in store in stock assortment to eCom customers. High out of stock rate creates negative customer experience and will result in customers not trusting ACI for ordering floral assortment via eCom. Also some of the floral assortment color variations are sold using the same UPC code, thus limiting our ability to track the correct inventory count for different colors. Asset: We will be building new asset for Floral assort selection and Inventory management to address the above problem statement. Floral business needs a new inventory management system for in store florists to mark assortment in and out stock at UPC level and also for color variations enabling updates in Web App in near real time. We are creating floral store front using AcuView for this functionality. Also we will creating new tools to automate validation of floral products images, prices etc to save time for business resources.

data.title: 26928 Custom Cakes solution on Ecom
data.description: Background and Problem Statement: Goal of In Store Parity ISP program is to make all products sold to customers in store are made available to eCom customers. ACI stores today are able to sell customized cakes with printed photo to in store customers using DecoPak vendor equipment and software available in store. This functionality is not available to eCom customers. Recently as a proof of concept eCom Order ahead functionality has been enabled in couple of stores. This was achieved by re directing our customer to an external DecoPak hosted website. This customer experience is not owned by ACI A customer data name, address, phone number is captured by vendor which is a privacy concern for ACI business B Email communications are owned by vendor and not ACI C Order data is not available in ACI systems thus limiting order edit, cancel and customer service experiences. Asset: We will replace the current customer experience owned by DecoPak with ACI native Web and App experiences allowing customers to remain on ACI site App. This includes ACI enabled A Product setup, browse, ability to customize including photo upload , search filter sort, ACI discounted member prices coupons rewards B Checkout leveraging in built privacy and digital trust infrastructure C Post Order edits cancel and Order history D Emails communications for Order life cycle E Backend integration with DecoPak for Cake customization

data.title: 26952 Digital Catalog Near Real Time Inventory Functionality
data.description: The Inventory Service provides the In Out of Stock inventory state to customers for all items in 1P and 3P Catalogs. Where available it also provides a unit inventory count. 1 Near Real Time Inventory State Engine will monitor inventory related events like in store sales and receiving plus 1P 3P Shopper OOS and update the Catalog Inventory State in response to those events. Moves us from a micro batch model to immediate response to the most recent inventory event. 2 Ingest the missing inventory counts from complex items e.g. multi selling UPC in stores and the Take Off inventory counts for MFC s. Items with inventory counts update inventory state in near real time and provide insight to Low Inventory conditions for 1P 3P customers.

data.title: 26850 Schedule and Save InHouse Platform Development Order edit capability and adaptability
data.description: Schedule and Save InHouse Platform Development Order edit capability and adaptability This asset is in relation to our newly built in house S S Platform and outlines the new capabilities of order flexibility and adaptability that are essential to achieve growth targets for FY24 by increasing order frequency and retaining the customers . Schedule and Save is a grocery subscription program and is still a novel idea in the industry. ACI s goal is to build the best in class grocery subscription program to win a portion of the opportunity estimated as a 2B. FY23 was focused on building core foundational capabilities to acquire customers through a seamless signup experience and developing ACI s home grown in house subscription platform while learning from NorCal division customers. FY24 will focus on building brand new advanced capabilities to offer a best in class subscription program that delivers all program goals from customer growth, AOV, and retention. The cost for this asset includes the build cost by the core team and dependent teams, towards building brand new advanced capabilities in following four areas as described below : 1 Build brand new capabilities to the platform to offer customers OPTIONS to update their order based on their ever changing needs provide the BEST VALUE 1.1 Build new subscription flexibility capabilities to allow customers to edit S S orders during T 5 for changing all order preferences and adding one time items to S S order 1.2 Build new capability to offer flexible Schedule and Save discounts varied and progressive discounts 1.3 Auto clip coupons on S S orders 1.4 Offer personalized savings tracker to show savings made by customers cumulatively on S S orders 1.5 Create Native experience on the Mobile App for SnS Management MSI 1.6 Capability to identify S S orders in acupick App to offer preferred fulfillment We are building the capabilities to address the customer feedback received from the Schedule and Save program and to further grow the program by building advanced capabilities in the platform to stand the best in class grocery subscription program. These new capabilities are needed to achive the growth target set for S S program for 70MM for FY2024. The flexibility and adaptability capabilities will unlock the opportunity to deliver on the promise of maximized convenience and savings to S S customers to create sticking experience for the customers and achieve the target of 50 customer retention . By offering customers options to update their order at any time and offering auto clip coupon feature, order skip rate will also reduce as customers will use the S S orders as primary orders to fulfill their weekly grocery needs and help us achieve the sales target of FY24. ACI digitally engaged customers

data.title: 26804 Paper to Digital List
data.description: Asset ID: 26804 Description: Our current Digital List capability requires customers to manually input the items they want to buy through either clipping deals, searching the digital aisle or manually typing and clicking on a product. We know that most customers actually use paper to write down their grocery needs throughout the week. We plan to convert the foundational GenAI OCR and ChatGPT technology invested by the Meals team to apply to more than just recipes. It will allow customers to take a picture of their paper list and have it match to all product types. Features: 1.1 Build a capability for customers to take a picture of a written list and convert into a digital list of text 1.2 Build a capability to convert multiple text items into a digital list of products 1.3 Build a capability for this digital list to integrate with available deals and allow customers to save them 1.4 Build the capability to show post discount pricing to customers on individual items and basket summary 1.5 Allow customers to save this list Business Benefit: We want to partner with current customer habits and reduce the friction required to try our digital shopping list. This will increase both the base of the users and the frequency of their visits. Est. In Service Date: 7 26 2024 Budget: 0.55M Approved 16 of total budget

data.title: 26891 Shopping List Platform Multilist
data.description: Asset ID: 26891 Description: Customers do not plan for just one thing at just one time. We have multiple events and occasions to plan and shop for at any given time. Thanksgiving, Troy s birthday party, Weekly Grocery Shop, Monthly staples shop are just some of the possibilities. We will build the functionality for customers to create, save and manage multiple lists at one time. Features: 2.1 Build the capability to group products and deals into specialized lists e.g. BIA, clipped, watch list, expiring soon . 2.2 Build a capability to have multiple lists so that customers can create templates for different events. 2.3 Build the capability to share a list with another customer ID to add and edit items. Business Benefit: By helping customers manage their lists across a longer time horizon Thanksgiving list used this year to serve as a template for next year , we save them time from recreating the same list from scratch. As they add more lists that can serve as templates, ACI will be positioned as their starting point for all future planning. Est. In Service Date: 11 3 2024 Budget: 1.33M SteerCo 3 26 24 39 of total budget

data.title: 26806 AI Powered Shoppability Engine
data.description: We want to allow customer to shop for recipes or recipe ingredients via list without having to make decisions about each individual product required. Today, we partially enable this with a rules based system that covers a limited set of ingredients. Our new shoppability engine will use AI to enable content to be instantly shoppable without requiring human curation. 1. We will build new, cutting edge semantic classification models to add key metadata, such as nutrition, allergens and dietary preference to new recipes ingredients added via User Generated Content UGC and CPG sponsored content, unlocking key personalization features, enabling better product matching and creating at scale solution for CPG sponsored content ingestion 2. Build new ML search models that use new ways of matching ingredients to products. This will both improve how we can match ingredients to suitable products and unlock self serve automation for CPG partners to import content and make it shoppable. 3. Provides API which can be leveraged across the organization to power product matching and personalization based on customer dietary preference 4. Replatform ESCP to ACI infrastructure Business requirement.

data.title: 26524 Shoppable Publishing House
data.description: Today, Enterprise Shoppable Content Platform is a simple data entry system for creating recipes used by only a couple teams that are highly trained on the platform. These recipes are created on static page templates with no allowance for customization or smart placement throughout our digital ecosystem. Proposed asset is a Publishing House which will replatform Enterprise Shoppable Content Platform, creating three key areas of functionality that allow us to meet evolving business needs that are currently limited by the exisiting system: Digital Merchandiser, an Integrater into the Ad Tech Collective Digital Bidding Platform and the ability for internal teams to self serve. 1 Self Service: We need to build new user Interfaces within Enterprise Shoppable Content Platform to enable self serve for new business stakeholders, including CPGs. We also need to build backend systems to combine data from the complex business logic entered into the UIs, with data pulled from external sources, including from our integrator with the Ad Tech Collective Digital Bidding Platform. 2 The Integrator Bidding unlocks Paid Sponsored i.e., Collective Shoppable Recipes to be placed throughout the digital customer experience. This includes an integration with the Collective s Digital Ad Tech platform to allow runtime ad bids for specific boosted placements. We ve depricated the legacy recipe publishing pipeline. As a result, we re no longer able to publish CPG sponsored recipe content. 3 Digital Merchandiser will allow us to move beyond static layouts and provide tailored logic to customize both layout and functionality on key pages scenes. This is necessary to provide a dynamic and contextual experience regardless of it being Sponsored, Division Specific or Nationally merchandized.

data.title: 26807 Food Assistant
data.description: The Food Assistant is a replatforming of the current Meal Plan functionality to be an AI driven comprehensive planning tool. We are building a series of new services to support new functionality for the Assistant Clare . Before launching the new assistant platform, we will launch these services in Meal Plans to test and refine them before incorporating them into the new platform. This assistant will have the ability to live throughout the UMA, Web and someday may even exist outside our own platforms such as an Alexa like device . Build a new rating aggregator system to collect and combine recipe ratings and reviews in order to provide user feedback signals to our shoppability engine to improve relevancy Build new capability that recommends a personalized combination of recipes, meals or bundles based on the customer s shopping history, taste, budget, and nutritional needs. Build new capability that synthesizes shopping history, preferences, list items, clipped coupons and deals to suggest a personalized shopping list. Build a new AI assistant capability that that provides personalized recommendations and answers to questions in real time.

data.title: Rewards for services New Ways to Earn Burn Points
data.description: Background: Business is looking at providing more options ways to customers to use their Points besides groceries and fuel current setup . Below are some of the other areas where earned Points can be used. Our launch of Rewards Simplified has made the B4U program easier for members to understand and earn value. Now we want to add more ways for members to use burn their points that will keep them engaged with the program and continue to shop with us in new ways. Today our members can use their earned points for free grocery items, gas discounts and or cash off. The loyalty strategy for 2024 includes launching point redemption offerings that will incentivize our members to shop more with us and across channels. We will begin offering Points for Services . With this new product offering, members will be able to use their points to pay for Delivery, Flash Delivery, Flash Pickup or the minimum order fee. In addition to services, members will also be able to donate their points to local charities. To ensure a seamless and intuitive experience for our members, we will create a distinct user interface within our App. This interface will effectively differentiate between core grocery gas cash offerings and the new Services and Donations features. By clarifying these distinctions, we aim to enhance member understanding and engagement while setting the foundation for future expansions and innovations within our loyalty program.

data.description: Purpose: The Navigation platform provides a foundation that helps orient the customer within our digital experiences to complete their tasks quickly. It shows the breadth of our digital portfolio and gives exposure and easy access to all the Albertson s programs. Size of the prize: By creating a robust navigation platform that helps our customers and supports our business needs, we believe we can drive 10.1M in incremental sales in FY24 6.9M from the web navigation redesign ensuring customers can easily find and access all our programs addtl. 1M opportunity with CPG ads 3.2M from quick access shortcuts to customers frequently occurring tasks as soon as they land on our Home screen Increase in NPS that enhances relevancy and overall customer messaging experience Customer Benefit: The structural navigation framework ensures discovery, consistency, and an uninterrupted customer experience, while seamlessly integrating new programs into our digital map, ensuring scalability and clarity as we grow Quick access predictive shortcuts will help customers complete their tasks in less steps, thereby eliminating friction in frequently used customer journeys. By leveraging OS capabilities like widgets, our app will be more easily accessible and top of mind for customers, driving more visits back to our app In app messaging ensures our customer messaging and promotions are relevant, contextual and does not come in the way of crucial navigation functions Roadmap: Roadmap.png thumbnail

data.title: ETA Engine
data.description: h2. Customer Problem: Today we observe consistent 10 negative feedback due to WISMO and 20 of total customer care contacts are due to WISMO. Clearly customers are missing required information which is resulting in customer taking alternate means to find the exact order status. Over the period of time this is cultivating in the negative experience and customer abrasion. h2. Benefit: 2 reduction in customer care contacts, 0.5 improvement NPS Score For delivery orders. Hypothesis No Order Status Hypothesis Use Case Scenario 1 Created We need an ETA when shopping will start Order Slot 2 to 4PM. Shopping starts at 10 10:30 am 2 Created We need an ETA when order will be ready for pickup or delivered Order Delivery Slot 2 to 4PM. Approx Delivery ETA 3:30 to 4PM Order Pickup Slot 2 to 4PM. Approx Order ready for pickup ETA 2:30 3PM 3 Picking Delay Provide an ETA to customer on when shopping will be completed and order will be ready for delivery or pickup Order delivery Slot 1PM 3PM, Due to Picking Delay, Order now will be delivered by 3:45PM. 4 PickUp Ready We need an ETA on the customer wait time at store to pickup the order Order Pickup time 4PM 5PM customer arrived at 7PM, checked in via to pickup the order, however customer is waiting for next 20 mins. 5 Delivery On The Way We need our internal ETA projection on when order will get delivered Last mile is not sending ETA updates for orders 6 Delivery On The Way We need to know chances of delivery re schedule Deliver Slot 7PM 9PM, driver pickup the order but there is no ETA update after 20 mins, customer is informed delivery on the way but doesn t reach 7 NA Provide real time update on order delivery status and ETA Customer is on order details page, however order status, ETA and Delivery Position doesnt change without customer interaction h2. Our Goal: Provide transparency and reduce negative sentiment due when order is delayed for delivery or pickup. h2. How we plan to Solve it: We plan to provide ETA throughout customer journey. This ETA can be predicted based on historical informationa and real time data from ground operations. Empowering customers with required information. When the order is out for delivery we plan to update the ETA in real time without customer interaction. We plan to enhance user experience by displaying ETA and contextualized communication throughout the journey.

data.title: Updated live order tracking
data.description: Extending Live Order Tracking to provide real time updates on following scenarios: No communication to customer between original ETA and delivery delay email There is no communication to the customer if the ETA gets delayed but is still before slot end time 10 min Eg Delivery slot of 4 8 PM Original ETA 4:30 PM There will be no communication to the customer if the order gets delayed and the new ETA is 8:05 PM 50 orders are delayed 15 mins beyond ETA. Lat long of truck driver not getting updated the order is delayed ETA Slot End Time 10 Min Lat long of the truck driver is not getting updated on the map once the ETA slot end time 10 min delayed delivery flow while ETA is getting updated No ETA range once ETA Slot End Time 10 Min We stop showing the 10 min ETA window when the ETA slot end time 10 min We show half cut map when we get incorrect lat long for the partners

data.title: Pet Care
data.description: Vision: Enhance the lives of pet owning households by offering a convenient, all in one digital solution for their pet needs. This platform will feature valuable educational content, services, savings, and rewards, along with the flexibility to choose between in store pickup or home delivery options. ACI Opportunity. In 2021, the pet industry was estimated to be worth around 110 billion, with ACI holding a market share of approximately 841 million 0.76 . Customer journey. We want to create a pet centric digital experience within the existing shopping app and website. This digital experience would share similar properties to Sincerely Health, enabling a contained wall garden experience that is catered to all things Pets. For the MLP, these digital properties would bring together a wide array of pet products and services including, but not limited to, pet food, supplies, treats, toys, OTC, prescription medications, real time advice and services, such as, veterinary telehealth and educational content and classes. Additionally, pet purchases made via these digital properties would be rewarded through the existing Albertsons loyalty and rewards program. Post 12 months, our vision is to create an all encompassing, personalized platform tailored to every pet s unique needs, based on species, age, and breed, personalizing food and health recommendations. We will expand our product portfolio, including dedicated Pet diagnostic kits for gut microbiome analysis and other health assessments.

data.title: Make Order Edit Easy and Streamlined

Customer problem: Order editing is a long and confusing process. Description: Simplify the UX for editing orders when an order is placed before the order has been processed for picking to bring awareness and simplicity for customers to engage with the digital capability for convenience. KPI: primary: Order Edit Success Rate Customer who started edited, completing the process secondary: increase units per transaction for those edited transactions secondary: increase revenue tertiary: increase repeat transactions for customers that edit their order Scope: Proposed UX solution Analytics tracking to support proposed UX solution Experimentation Execution Development

data.title: Data Products: Identity Node and Clean Room
data.description: Identity Node Creating a secure, HIPAA compliant zone where identity data from all sources can be resolved to create a new unique identifier to be used across the enterprise. Clean Room A Data Clean Room is a highly controlled and regulated data warehouse containing de identified customer and pharmacy data. This data is tokenized and aggregated with a unique identifier from the Identity Node with PII and PHI information stripped from records. These records can then be safely combined with other datasets to produce aggregate insights. Use cases include but are not limited to: Aggregate customer reporting, advertising and media collective, data commercialization and data partnerships.

data.title: QR code enablement for 3P
data.description: Problem: Currently checkers at POS are required to enter loyalty numbers for each partner manually which error prone and results in operational inefficiencies. Also, since the partners collect taxes from customers as part of the sale, checkers need to manually tax exempt from the transaction at checkout. This is also a manual process. Opportunity: Leverage QR codes to automatically update loyalty tax information thus avoiding shopper infractions, increasing efficiency and potentially expand to using QR codes for ACH payments, thus aiding removal of Marqueta fees on transactions Solution: Solve for Internal Operational Efficiencies Related to Manual Tax Exemption Reconciliation through QR codes that can presented to the checker at checkout. PRD QR code for tax exemption for IC, DD and Uber Partnerships Albertsons Confluence safeway.com https: confluence.safeway.com display PAR QR code for tax exemption for IC 2C DD and Uber

data.title: B2B eCommerce P0 P5
data.description: Summary: This initiative will build a scalable eCommerce solution to serve the food needs of B2B customers, that results in incremental revenue for ACI while leveraging our existing technology and processes. Today, we already serve thousands of businesses through our current eCommerce properties, who will deliver 15M in FY 2022. These businesses purchase beverages, produce, fresh meals and pantry items as a perk for office employees, to restock their kitchens to serve meals to residents and guests, and to serve the community by sending groceries to at risk members in the community. By creating a scalable solution, we aspire to build a 500M B2B ecommerce business for Albertsons in the next 5 years for which we are seeking approval for 4M in CAPEX and 1.4M in OPEX in FY23.

data.title: FY23: SNAP Customer experience optimizations web app
data.description: Link to business case: SNAP EBT Deep Dive Draft 1 230214.pptx https: rxsafeway my.sharepoint.com :p: r personal dghat01 safeway com Documents Documents SNAP 20EBT 20Deep 20Dive 20Draft 201 20 230214.pptx d w611f00cf2bd74240b750d489c8884d27 csf 1 web 1 e rnvbLm . Enable customers to conveniently shop online with EBT with elevated CX journeys in discoverability of eligible products, increasing awareness of EBT as a payment method and re engaging EBT customers to shop often. Lifting online EBT sales penetration from 5.6 to 7.4 by end of FY23, be at par with in store penetration with 10.9 by FY24 and aspire to get to 13 by FY25 and increase the repeat rate for the EBT customers Customer Needs: Expand our community based goals by enabling customers with low income and mobility challenges to seamlessly shop and purchase EBT eligible items at Albertsons. Help them discover EBT payment option, items eligible and savings for the same to bring affordability and convenience of shopping online together see EBT shopper segmentation in appendix, slide 43 . Identified gaps from competitive analysis: To become industry leaders in SNAP EBT online experience, we need to close gaps in discoverability of eligible products, market the acceptance of EBT payment method on our digital channels and improve our help center to educate on SNAP EBT offerings with ACI. Additionally, streamlining checkout process, making it easy for customers to manage EBT payment card balance and enhance the post purchasing journey by highlighting EBT items, charge allocations in order details online receipts. Roadmap to close the gaps: We will optimize customer experience for web app across the known gaps, by providing targeted journeys to EBT households to aid discovery, shopping and re purchase of eligible products across all shopping funnels. We will be on par with industry baseline experience by Q3 FY23 across all the customer shopping journeys. With additional discovery and awareness, we anticipate a growth in EBT customer base across households. Business benefits: With the customer experience enhancements planned to close the gap in discovery, awareness and optimizing purchasing journeys, we aim to accelerate EBT online sales penetration from 5.6 to 7.4 by FY23, be on par with in store peaks with 10.9 by FY24 and aspire to get to 13 by FY25. We also expect to increase the repeat rate for EBT customers will work with customer analytics team to set the right target goal as next steps Risks Assumptions: The sales penetration goal does not account for reduction in EBT fund allocation. Per government announcements EBT funds are reduced by 3 for households bringing it to pre pandemic level. We are keeping an eye out on current EBT customer spend with reduced funding, and we will re evaluate our goals at the end of FY23 to assess the impact and adjust accordingly with changing trends. This plan assumes a funding of 1.7M per year for the team to work on the identified roadmap in FY23 and the following fiscal years.

data.description: Background: Today, eDeals are getting published to Apex which is feeding WIMS and Vendor Deal BoD for EDM and CABS to consume. Unified Promotions Platform will be a best in class promotional platform creating a seamless user experience across our Merchants, Vendors from planning, forecasting, and detailing to executing promotions across store and ecommerce channels. UPP will consolidate capabilities across promotional process by implementing a single task based user workflow that encompass functionality within dozen plus promotional systems by end of FY22. Objective of this change is to decommission APEX and feed deals and allowance directly from MEUPP. Allowence API to be published from MEUPP to be consumed by EDM Problem Statement: While we are still able to provide promotional offers to the guest, the time consumed from merchandising teams in making the systems work together is arduous and inefficient. Creating an in house unified platform will allow users to use one succinct interface to make decisions that will make promotional planning and execution with vendors seamless. When is this needed: Priority End of Q2 2023 Business Value ROI : Revenue generation LPM Score if it is a business initiative. 43 1. Reduce efforts spent by our merchants 500 and Vendors on promotional activities by at least 20 by consolidating capabilities across Periscope, eDeals, APEX and CMS that removes double keying and quality checks of data that consume majority of department specialists time effort e.g., incorrect items, incorrect dates, missing promotion IDs etc. 2. Cost reduction in use of vendor tools e.g., 2.1M with McKinsey Vendor portal and 1.2M with eDeals etc. as we consolidate the experiences and capabilities 3. Increase effectivity of our trade desk performance across divisions by introducing capabilities that are system managed guardrails of division promotions and allowances. Actual margin or desk improvements metrics are TBD. 4. Increase Net Promoter Score NPS of tools and processes observed across 300 users from 25 to 25 Is it Compliance Legal requirement if no impact No Data Producers: UPP Unified Promotion Platform Data Consumers: EDM, WIMS and CABS Data Volume: History: N A Frequency: Sample Files Data Attributes: Monitoring requirements: Primary Key: Data Quality requirements: Acceptance Criteria: UAT: Smarish Babu MEUPP Mirela D. data.title: Proactive Subs: low Inventory messaging on order confirmation
data.description: Business Problem : 67 of brand new customers bnc that shop within a given qtr do not return the following qtr. One of the biggest reasons that they don t continue shopping e comm is, 1 Out of stock OOS at fulfillment is 14 and 2 irrelevant subs. 46 of customers reported they received irrelevant substitutions. The primary reason for this is customers are unable to select their substitute backup product in the UI web app as we don t surface any messaging for items that are most likely to go out of stock or already out of stock. Getting our low inventory likelihood to be OOS subs experience is pivotal for customer retention and loyalty. Vision : we receive sub selection directly from customer Scope for pilot : One division Time frame for pilot : 3 months Requirements We are able to predict items that have a higher likelihood of going out of stock in our e comm stores. We are able to surface low inventory messaging in the customer journey so that our customers are able to select a substitute product ahead of fulfillment. Today, we have subs associated with all products without any logic We don t want to incorrectly prompt nudge the customer multiple times in the customer journey resulting in frustration and a loss of trust in our brand and in our inventory prediction. Low inventory prediction model takes into consideration the supply, demand, historical availability, or lack of availability of products by category, time of the day, delivery method, picker availability, seasonality, and sales forecasts et al before marking an item as low in stock OSS Low in stock OOS is as close as possible not specific enough to real time inventory or xhours of lag max depending on fulfillment method Consistent low in stock OOS items across e comm and physical store Low inventory OOS flag consumed by catalog and info shared with smart subs API so that appropriate messages can be shared with the customer at critical customer journeys KPIs Irrelevant Not relevant subs customer satisfaction decrease Avg order size increase or decrease will have to be tested No subs not sure how this will trend Picker compliance NPS Refunds Confluence Page : https: confluence.safeway.com display CDT Low inventory updated req
