data.title: Discovery to identify customer location when in store
FY23 Customer Account Management CAM
data.description: Goal: Create an adaptable, universal account hub that empowers our customers to connect and control all parts of their personalized shopping journey including savings, deals and healthy living. In order to successfully support SHX OKRs and goals across all the business pillars for FY2023, the customer account will evolve quickly to incorporate new functionality, services, engagement platforms and personalization. Ultimately, we will have a deeper understanding of our customers that will enable us to serve them better Customer benefit ACI customers will be now able to connect their currently fragmented membership, rewards, and shopping journeys with the consolidated Account Management Hub. The Account hub will act as a single source of truth for our customers, empowering them to manage their own personal information, settings, and preferences in a few easy taps. Customers can also secure their wallet, health, and identity information in a familiar way using biometrics ex: FaceID . With an elevated account experience, our customers will have the flexibility to update and manage information most important to them, in their preferred channel of engagement, and still have the most personalized experience anywhere they choose to engage with us. When customers access their Account hub, they will be greeted with a contextual dashboard that lets them easily pick up their shopping journey where they left off and stay up to date with their evolving shopping needs. Customer Journey Mina, a single mother with a full time job needs help with her family s weekly groceries and meals. To shop smarter, Mina has her weekly items on repeat. She gets a reminder, repeat order is confirmed and is set to arrive tomorrow. She taps to open her Albertsons app and sees a snapshot of her upcoming order on her account dashboard. On the dashboard, she has an alert that she received 25 back in Albertsons cash that can be used towards her next purchase. At a glance, she can see where she left off shopping last time under her recently viewed section. She also sees some recipes from her saved for later list right under her dashboard. She picks up shopping recipes where she left off. With her payments securely integrated into her wallet, Mina s 25 in Albertsons cash is automatically applied, and she completes her transaction in one tap. Post purchase, she can view her rewards and points earned with this order on her Account dashboard. Patricia, a former regular shopper, opens her Albertsons app for the first time in a while. She recently moved and is closer to an Albertsons store now. As she is a returning shopper, she s welcomed back to the experience with familiarity. She sees vegetarian friendly items across the app as she has already told us about her dietary preference in one of her previous sessions. As she is clipping her first deal, she is alerted that her profile is incomplete, and she can earn a reward by completing it. She taps the alert to access her account where she can see her previous purchases, preferences, available rewards, and new features. She connects her apple wallet and health app in a couple of taps securely with FaceID. Her health and dietary information is imported into her account. She sees a message that low sugar and 3 other preferences have been added. Patricia is now able to shop for low sugar, vegetarian friendly items, recipes, and recommendations easily due to her preferences. She wants to add her partner so they can shop and plan a healthier lifestyle together. She adds her partner via SMS to her account and shares her current shopping cart. . Size of the Prize: 209.5M 3 year for account management wallet impact , Business savings 530K Connecting customer s account hub to their inspirational journey across omni experiences to self serve better shopping relevancy tied to personalization. Impacting overall digital sales by 0.5 1 resulting in 17M incremental revenue trending higher customer satisfaction rate above 81 for digital channels. Consistent sign in and account creation net new 195k registrations reducing churn rate by 15 incremental value 7M. Persistent web sign in for parity increase total signed in visitors by 15 higher Customer adoption rate leading to increase in sign in rate by 8 . Convert in store customer to online by automating J4U account process. Conversion rate of 25 incremental revenue of 11.7M Experiment and A B test one tap account creation by expanding guest capabilities. 5 unique guest visitors to convert incremental revenue of 41M Call reduction for customer service : Order inquires by 50 60 , savings of 92,400 Account management and profile by 40 , savings of 195K per year. screenshot 1.png thumbnail Roadmap FY23: https: rxsafeway my.sharepoint.com :x: r personal dbhan01 safeway com layouts 15 Doc.aspx sourcedoc 7B6040F39B A930 4BC8 87B3 C3CCACFD5A1D 7D file CAMP 202023.xlsx action default mobileredirect true cid 8ef1dcfa 616b 4d78 aa83 0af6364ba341. data.title: Building Lists for Products
data.description: h1. Strategy h3. What is a List Every person in the world uses a list. It could be mental, written, or digital. A list is a memory tool to help reduce cognitive load and opportunities to forget something of note. A list is also a collaboration tool to gather inputs from variety of sources. We want to help customers remember all the items they need to pick up either in store or add to their cart for an order. Customers primary unit of a list is product centric. Although with the introduction of Weekly Ads and Sales, customers also shop with a Deal on the surface with the product mentally noted. h3. Current Pain Points I don t know if I m getting an eligible product for a Deal Customers want to shop by product Making a list is a manual process h3. List Tenets What makes an awesome list Never forgets List will always be there when a customer needs a reminder while remembering their past and frequent purchases. Easily accessible List is instantly available when a customer pulls it out to write a reminder or uses it to shop. Fosters collaboration List is easily shareable and helps households manage their wants and needs together. Simple path to purchase List provide customers with a simple path to purchase their lists, whether online or in store. Inspires variety List incites creativity with the ingredients a customer frequently uses. h3. Goals, KPIs, Metrics What does winning look like FY2023 Goals Increase Item List penetration Baseline: 4 weeks ending 10 29 0.7 By end of Q2, 10 of UMA customers are using Lists By end of FY2023, 25 of digitally engaged customers are using Lists across web and UMA KPIs of customers that used List in the last 4 weeks Number of finger taps to useful list Omni customers of list items purchases

data.title: FY23 Simple, Frictionless Purchasing Journey
data.description: Goal: Make Albertsons purchasing journey so simple, efficient, and secure that all our customers want to shop online every week Customer benefit Albertsons makes it so quick and simple for me to get my groceries for my family with a seamless buying experience. It is super easy to transfer all the items on my weekly list to cart, the fulfillment and wallet options always meet my needs and the whole buying process takes only a couple of minutes out of my day. Even when I forget something, Albertsons has me covered because of how flexible it is to add to my in progress order. Customer journey Mina is at a soccer game with her son and needs to plan for dinner for her family as well as groceries for the week. She does not have the time to do a full, in store grocery run. Mina opens her Albertsons app and builds a cart from her in store usuals, recipes, etc. She can quickly reconcile her list with her cart and be confident that she has everything she needs and trusts all her available deals are applied. And when she s in checkout, the fulfillment and desired wallet options are laid out so seamlessly and securely, that she checks out with ease using her saved credit card and easily applies her cash back rewards with a single tap. She is confident in her purchase and is clear on her delivery pickup details. After the game, her son requests snacks for him and his friends. No worries, Mina can edit her in progress order easily and get everything she needs in time without needing to stop at the store on the way home. Size of the Prize: 154M 3 year for checkout simplification wallet impact In Q2, 2.5M customers created carts online but went in store to shop. Through a simple, frictionless purchasing journey, converting .5 of these in store only customers into omni shoppers whom we know spend 19 more week or 1K year, we ll bank an additional 50M incremental revenue year. In addition, we will reduce cart abandonment for online shoppers currently 30 abandon their cart . If we re able to move our edit penetration from 11 to 15 , we ll add approximately 8M in incremental revenue per year. Financial Projection In Millions FY23 FY24 FY25 Incremental Sales 35M 58M 61M Incremental EBITDA 3.15M 5.22M 5.49M OpEx 0.5M 0.51M 0.53M CapEx 1.54M 1.58M 1.63M Success Metrics Forecasted Actuals Conversion rate 5 FY23 2.45 In store eCom penetration .5 10M HHIDs of order edits 15 4 11 Incremental order edit revenue 8M 2.6M 5.4M Non functional requirements Looking at our customers who have an intent to shop with us online, which was 2.9M HH in Q2, 68 of them complete a transaction, our opportunity lies in streamlining checkout for that remaining 30 that abandoned cart or checkout. In addition, when we look at the 56 of HH that are creating a cart but ultimately shopping in store, making the current cumbersome 10 step process smooth enough to go through could encourage our customers to shop online. Order editing has decreased from 18 to now 11 . Enhancing this experience to allow the flexibility to edit in progress shopped right now orders enables our customers to add more, which today is an average 12 per order Enhancement inputs through Division, Customer, NPS Feedback and research inputs

data.title: Albertsons Site Re skin
data.description: Customer Problem Statement Current Albertsons sites are dated and are still based on color design from years ago There is a huge disconnect in theme colors, look and feel of the Albertsons website and new UMA mobile app Homepage re design initiative is going LIVE in January 2022. After the GO LIVE, the Albertsons homepage will look completely different from the rest of the site. Customer experience on the website will be negatively impacted as product cards will look different on different pages. Business Problem Statement CPG partners cannot use the new banners created on the Homepage on other pages through the site. CPG revenue for 2022 will be negatively impacted. All new placements on other pages on the site will have to be replaced within a few months or delayed until the whole site is restructured as per new design The tech teams will have to maintain two different versions of all webpages until the whole site is integrated into a the new design theme. This would be additional overhead. Business Outcome Hypothesis: UMA App Parity Support CPG Goals Advertise OWN brands Improved customer experience Support Market place and Food Authority and other strategic initiatives that are following new design theme and colors Pillar OKR Alignment and KPIs Improved customer experience Increased AOV Additional CPG revenue Increased business revenue for OWN brands Scope: Re skin the following pages on ALL ABS banner sites on web Aisle and category pages Search pages PDP pages Pharmacy pages J4U and loyalty pages Other landing pages Cart and Checkout pages. UCA pages All pages need to be integrated with DST before adapting to new V2 design theme.

data.title: Catalog: Digital Bundles
data.description: Epic Name DCAT: Catalog: Digital Bundles Epic Owner Shrikant Subramanian Pillar Catalog Selection Epic Description This initiative will provide the customer the ability to buy pre curated digital bundles items that are grouped together, initially with a manual effort . Customers will be afforded the convenience of shopping, and in subsequent phases will be able to take advantage of discounts based on basket size of digital bundle. For all Albertsons customers across all banners who are shopping for items that could be bundled together the Digital Bundles initiative is a way for them to get frictionless shopping experience that communicates any items that have digital bundles unlike our current process which does NOT our solution allows them to get related products as a curated digital bundle. Business Outcomes 22M upside to 45M is easily visible by amplifying with supplier and merchandising support to drive many occasions, including Meals OKRS Enable digital bundles features for x SKUs to realize business outcome above. Non functional Requirements Tech Requirements: All APIs that are built modified need to have backward compatibility Deployment has to occur simultaneously for web and mobile UMA and legacy Ability to deploy digital bundles feature in a phased manner by category or other classification is required. Functional Requirements As a customer, I expect a frictionless shopping journey. When I embark upon my shopping journey, some of my expectations are: Less time spent on adding items to my cart this will occur when I have to click once to add multiple items to the cart that are grouped together. Ability to leverage all the deals coupons promotions within that group of items To enable the above expectations, several features need to be built both from the backend and from the front end UX perspective. This initiative needs to be deployed for the web, mobile UMA and legacy . Customer facing Requirements web : Customer is presented with pre curated digital bundles that are made up of individual items that customers typically buy together e.g. pizza, wings, chips The Product Display Page has to accommodate the display of all items in the bundle first as a group of items, and then the customer should be able to click on each individual item to see the individual item characteristics. Digital bundles presented to the customer have the following attributes on the PDP page, when clicked on each individual item: Price Image Availability Promos Deals Coupons When there are multiple items in the digital bundle and 1 or more of the individual items in the bundle are OOS, the customer should still be able add the bundle with the available items to the cart. The price for the bundle should get adjusted based on the items that are actually available for e.g. if the price of the b Customer facing Requirements mobile UMA and legacy app : Enable items with similar characteristics to be grouped together this will be enabled on the front end with the work done by the Catalog Operations team on the Catalog UI tool Customer is presented with pre curated digital bundles that are made up of individual items that customers typically buy together e.g. pizza, wings, chips The Product Display Page has to accommodate the display of all items in the bundle first as a group of items, and then the customer should be able to click on each individual item to see the individual item characteristics. Digital bundles presented to the customer have the following attributes on the PDP page, when clicked on each individual item: Price Image Availability Promos Deals Coupons When there are multiple items in the digital bundle and 1 or more of the individual items in the bundle are OOS, the customer should still be able add the bundle with the available items to the cart. The price for the bundle should get adjusted based on the items that are actually available adjust pricing based on items that are available versus OOS . Catalog UI Requirements Ability to create digital bundles by grouping BPNs together based on similar characteristics Ability to create a shell group called Digital Bundle via the Catalog UI tool. This digital bundle should have the ability to add multiple items within itself for e.g. a digital bundle for Super Bowl could contain 3 items pizza, beer and wings Ability to add and remove items within a group. This addition should be reflected on the website in near real time When customer has a bundle in their cart and there was a change in the bundle, this change should be detected during checkout. If a bundle was changed after checkout, then there should be no impact to the customer order for fulfillment. Feature List Solution Details Customer sketches, user flows, and design mockups attached to this epic Epic Type Enabler epic type it falls under, or if Business epic Dependencies: Team Feature Catalog Refer to catalog UI requirements above to see impact. Backend API and DB changes could be potentially in scope. Fulfillment Need to understand Fulfillment impact what would be a single line item in the past, would now be coming through to the fulfillment team as multiple products since customer chose a digital bundle. Mobile Replicate web features in alignment with mobile offering for UMA and legacy app. Cart Checkout Cart Checkout need to understand the impact if the customer changes a bundle in the cart to a non bundle item and vice versa. There may be impact to order acknowledgement email and the format. UX Design customer experience UX for both web and mobile UMA and legacy OMS OMS will be impacted since multiple items will now be added as a single line item, potentially. This part will become clear during architecture review. Search and Browse Ability for searching bundles. Ability to show bundles if an item that is part of a bundle is searched. BloomReach Impact to BR feed needs to be assessed. Will the bundle offering be sent separately, will there be an impact to the format etc. will be questions that can be answered during architecture review. Timeline: Tasks Needed Sprint Target Release Date Estimated Completion Date

data.title: Optiva NIMS integration with Catalog

data.title: Item Restrictions
data.description: Epic Name DCAT : Item Restrictions: Inventory Availability Epic Owner Shrikant Subramanian Pillar Catalog Selection Epic Description https: confluence.safeway.com pages viewpage.action spaceKey CDT title Item Restrictions This initiative will resolve customer pain points with regards to fulfillment of items that have legal or store restrictions. The business requirements that have been outlined will require solutions to mitigate customer issues around restricted items do not get fulfilled on time, or not at all. For all Albertsons customers across all banners who are shopping for items that may have restrictions or limitations the Item Restrictions initiative is a way for them to get frictionless shopping experience that communicates any limitation or restriction upfront unlike our current process which does NOT our solution allows them to get what is allowed by law and store limitations Business Outcomes 2000 bps lower OTT on 7 of the orders exception orders 140 bps better OTT current OTT 96 overall order count. Increase fill rate by up to 1 , representing up to 12 million additional annual revenue 23mil 52 weeks 1.2 billion 0.01 restricted items foregone revenue fill rate 12million OKRS Launch process for x SKUs for items that have restrictions or limitations Non functional Requirements Functional Requirements As a customer, I expect a frictionless shopping journey. In this regard, I expect that any type of item that I buy shows any restrictions upfront during my shopping experience. Also, any kind of restrictions on account of geography, timing, quantities, delivery is conveyed to me clearly and as soon as possible in the journey. This epic is expected to mitigate customer pain points during the journey for purchasing restricted items and items that have limitations due to the following sections marked A and B : A. Updates geography, timing, limitations, quantities, transportation to databases, APIs etc. to enable features. Geography to adhere to local laws for counties, cities, states if a certain zip code where the item is being shipped to is covered by a law that prevents an item to be delivered, has to be provided upfront and if the store has changed during shopping. Timing with regards to store limitations for e.g. do not sell alcohol in Texas prior to 12.00 noon on Sunday . Enable store limitations with regards to enabling purchase of restricted or non restricted items for e.g. alcohol prior to a certain time or not allowing sushi before 11 AM Enable quantity limitations on purchase of restricted items at all points where an item can be added during cart and checkout, in the product card. For e.g., adhere to local laws with regard to quantities when enabling the purchase of cough cold medications. The story for this item will have more details on different use cases . Transportation Restrictions to comply with health regulations based on carrier. Ability for Catalog systems to ingest and maintain attributes from POS systems related to geography and timing related to local laws in essence, maintain a global repository with the ability to get updates from various local POS systems B. Enable a rich customer UX experience mobile and web with the ability to block inform customer of restricted item constraints at the beginning of the journey and maintain that position throughout the journey. For e.g., for item quantities, let the customer know about restrictions at the time of adding items to the cart AND not let the customer add additional items during checkout. Feature List Geography to adhere to local laws for counties, cities, states if a certain zip code where the item is being shipped to is covered by a law that prevents an item to be delivered, has to be provided upfront and if the store has changed during shopping. Transportation Restrictions to comply with health regulations based on carrier. data.title: Marketplace Automate Onboarding
data.description: KPIs: 250k Live SKUs 1 conversion rate for every 10k new selection 1 Challenge Opportunity There is currently a 65 step process to get a new seller live on Marketplace. With several pre checks, and back and forth excel files around approved skus, categories, and brand spelling normalization, the ability to quickly onboard new sellers and ingest new skus is not possible. Besides the back and forth process, a 131 attribute template must be completed where only 16 fields are required. This requires the seller to comb through fragmented pre approved sku lists, and then complete steps for attributes such as product taxonomy and tax codes. Once this template is completed, verified and imported by the Marketplace team not the seller , additional outsourced touchpoints are required to review catalog integration layers and vetting rejections. If this process isn t automated and brought to scale, we will be unable to launch our projected 38 sellers and 320k skus by the end of 2023, further detail seen here https: jira.safeway.com smalh06 safeway com Documents Documents Sellers Seller 20strategy 2023 . We will begin to have a backup of sellers to launch due to the timing to complete all manual steps. This will in turn lead to less skus and sellers than our competitors, as well as low seller engagement, product newness, and market readiness. Example Features: Frictionless seller selection onboarding Robust API connects with integrators like M connect, Channel Advisor etc. Deduping logic Seller imports all available skus into Marketplacer and Marketplacer decides which skus are approved Automate analytics tagging Tagging for Adobe Analytics automatically associated to each new seller vs 2 sprints of set up and testing Sample Seller journey As the 1 distributor of Asian food, I am on 25 Marketplaces and get new skus from my suppliers everyday. My total assortment has 55,000 skus, and I get about 50 new everyday. Ease in onboarding new skus is extremely important to me and marketplaces that allow me to do so have more skus live than other sellers, and always have the latest and greatest new items. What makes onboarding easy for me is consistency across information and marketplaces, as well as self sufficiency in being able to complete all tasks within a marketplaces interface API . I tend to be more engaged by working autonomously and managing my listings directly through Marketplacer. If I can import all new skus I receive from my suppliers and there is no back and forth with the marketplaces account team having to remove skus for a seller already selling it or their first party business already selling it , and all required fields easily map to an attribute already in my system, then I am able to quickly onboard new skus. Where I usually come across issues is a lack of consistency across marketplaces when it comes to taxonomy and tax codes. The marketplaces that work the best for me are one s where I can supply them with my internal taxonomy and they have algorithms that map it to theirs, as well as take that taxonomy to apply a tax code. If I must go sku by sku for each of these fields, I can only do 1k skus a week vs thousands if I can use my own attribution.

data.title: 26949 ADAM scalability and improved performance
data.description: Based on Asset: Re architecture ADAM assets ingestion process and automation to reduce redundancy, process digital assets faster with minimal lag on OMNI channel. Improve number of assets process per hour by 20 . Baseline ADAM Image Ingestion Workflows followed by 10 improvement in FY Q3 Q4. Build robust dashboard to view important stats and vitals about assets, coverage details, metadata, source etc. Empower Business users with better and efficient features and content richness. ADAM stands for Albertson s Digital asset Manager. This is an existing Adobe tool that is used by ACI teams as their central repository for all digital assits with ACI. It houses various integration with teams like Catalog, Offer Mangement and OrderAhead. It is also used by various team to house creative files, company logos, etc. This platform was launched 3 years ago keeping in mind the needs of the users then. Over the last 3 years this platform has grown and so have the users. It has become a hub for digital assets. With chanding time, there is a need to re platform this tool to cater to latest usecases. With the required re platform and expansions, our tool will be able to 1. Manage transfer of assets from internal and external users 2. Improved SLA 3. Improved Perfomance 4. Monitoring and reporting 5. Improved Meta Data 6. ADAM Meta data into EDM Ease of use: We want our internal and external customers to reap the benefits of this tool with not just basic image upload functionality but also added benefits like product tagging, search etc. This will excite our users to use ADAM beyond its core features. We want to improve our collaboration with our 3rd party vendors external customers by giving them the opportunity to accept and share digital assets with ease. Today our process is cumbersome and can deter vendors from being effective. Centralized Asset Management: We re connecting all our digital asset tools and workflows into one system ADAM for better organization and control. Streamlining Asset Flow: We re building a service to easily exchange images with our vendors and agencies, making it faster to get their assets into our system and delivery on Web and Mobile App. Supercharged Search Personalization: We ll use detailed information metadata about the assets to improve search results and personalize campaigns for our users. Moving Assets Efficiently: We re migrating assets from another system division assets third party systems and building tools to automate this process using Azure. Faster Asset Processing Powerful Dashboard: We re optimizing how assets are processed in ADAM to handle them quicker and with minimal delay. We re also building a comprehensive dashboard to give users easy access to important asset information. Old Description: This epic includes all new features and enhancements for ADAM Q3 2022 Features include: Transfer Ivie images into ADAM Simplify workflow from ADAM to Scene7 Vendor Portal Brand Portal Other ADAM Enhancements: Automate ADAM image meta data process Catalog with the help of ADAM to automate the process of getting image information from the triage folder, dropping it in azure, Catalog picking the file and processing it manual intervention will be stopped https: jira.safeway.com browse MCA 1626 Send only meta data to ADAM for wellness claims Catalog to refresh ADAM with all wellness claims once ADAM has the capability to accept only meta data without the image url MCA 1636 Catalog will be able to send only Meta data to ADAM Without Image url Safeway Jira Former Description prior to chainging to Asset Description: Albertson s Digital Asset Management ADAM Enhancements

data.title: Enhanced Marketplace Catalog for DoorDash
data.description: Background: Albertsons works with multiple grocery delivery platforms Instacart, DoorDash, Uber Shipt , allowing customers to purchase groceries on their marketplace and have them delivered. As part of this partnership, we provide daily, automated feed of our catalog, so that our assortment is properly displayed on their platform. Daily catalog feed contains store level assortment for ecomm non ecomm stores. As part of catalog feed, we provide two files: Item data i.e. Assortment and Promo file i.e. pricing promo info. see attached sample files. OSPI ITEM CSTORES.csv Item, OSPI PROMO CSTORES.csv Pricing promo For ecomm stores, we use Albertsons 1 st party catalog as baseline and for all allowed available items UPCs BPNs, we extract other attributes and create item and promo file. For non ecomm stores, we use 3 week look back logic of POS transaction logs for the list of items sold and then to extract other attributes to curate the assortment. Once the catalog files are created, we upload those files to SFTP sites for our partners to consume. Since same files are provided to all our partners, we do not have flexibility to customize the assortment, pricing and markup. To avoid this and give us more operational flexibility, we want to create custom catalog feeds to each our partners. Catalog Requirements for DoorDash: Data source: For ecomm enabled stores, extract the data from Catalog Runtime DB Non Ecomm: extract POS transaction Logs with the ability to customize look back period 21days, 7 days, 1day, etc Attributes columns : Extract the item product attributes from Runtime DB. See existing sample feed for columns attributes. 3PM Catalog Columns SampleData.xlsx Remove unused columns : ABS SUPPLIER NUM, ABS UNIT OF MEASURE, ABS PRICE AS CODE, ABS SUBCAT NM, ABS REG RETAIL QTY New Additional columns : BPN, Brand Name need a mechanism to distinguish Albertsons own brand items from National brands , Department, Group, Category, Class, Subclass, SubSubClass, Sales Rank , Wellness Tags, Avg weight, Purchase Qty Limit where applicable , CRV Volume Based Alcohol Taxes where applicable e.g. stores in WA, IL , Image URLs, Availability inventory Signal Note : We will review the final list with DoorDash and Add Delete Modify attributes list as needed Markup : Need ability to customize markup per partner especially for Alcohol items where partners are not allowed to markup on their own because of regulatory constraints Exclusions: Need to exclude category of items e.g. Tobacco, Alcohol, Bulk Bakery, Floral, Greeting cards to meet business, operational and regulatory requirments.

data.title: 26925 Product Base Variants
data.description: Epic Name DCAT : Catalog: Product Variants Epic Owner Shrikant Subramanian Pillar Catalog Selection Epic Description The objective of this initiative is to include variants as part of the assortment for the online digital catalog. A specific item that is grouped with related options to form one distinguishable product set is known as a product variant. Product variants have unique identifiers https: www.datafeedwatch.com blog brand mpn gtin product identifiers for google shopping ga 2.195359081.419123941.1576224844 634939040.1576224844 , such as price, and every variant is based on the same product definition. For all Albertsons customers across all banners who are shopping for items that may have variants the Product Variants initiative is a way for them to get frictionless shopping experience that communicates any items that have variants unlike our current process which does NOT our solution allows them to get all the product variants in one page, thereby increasing customer satisfaction, and reducing lost sales. Business Outcomes 10M upside in conversion due to increase in AOV. OKRS Enable product variant features for x SKUs to Non functional Requirements Tech Requirements: All APIs that are built modified need to have backward compatibility Deployment has to occur simultaneously for web and mobile UMA and legacy Ability to deploy product variants feature in a phased manner by category or other classification is required. Functional Requirements As a customer, I expect a frictionless shopping journey. When I embark upon my shopping journey, some of my expectations are: Less time spent on adding items to my cart Less time searching for items with different flavors sizes Less confusion with all my coupons promotions deals for similar items in one place. To enable the above expectations, several features need to be built both from the backend and from the front end UX perspective. This initiative needs to be deployed for the web, mobile UMA and legacy . Customer facing Requirements web : Enable items with similar characteristics to be grouped together this will be enabled on the front end with the work done by the Catalog Operations team on the Catalog UI tool Similar items grouped together should be searchable Variants will need to have associated deals coupons available as part of the variant offering in PDP Ability to nominate a variant as primary variant. This decision should be made based on highest sales within a group of items if vanilla ice cream is the bestseller, vanilla ice cream should be the primary variant. This variant will also be need to be replaced by another variant when primary variant is OOS. For e.g. if vanilla ice cream is OOS, nominate strawberry ice cream as the primary variant. Retain the vanilla ice cream as a regular product variant not primary and show that as OOS. Every individual variant should be accompanied with a swatch image that should display additional details when the customer hovers over the swatch image. Every variant should have inventory availability associated with it for e.g. strawberry ice cream can be OOS, whereas the ability to display actual counts or inventory availability for other flavors should be available. A category should have the variant feature implemented for 2 attributes: for e.g. size and flavor . Different categories may have different attributes that make up a variant: for e.g. in frozen category, implement If product variants within a variant group have different prices, those prices should be available on the PDP. PDP behavior should have a collection of swatch images clicking on each swatch image should show the various attributes for that variant: price, inventory, image, deals coupons promotions. A category should have the variant feature implemented for 2 attributes: for e.g. size and flavor . Different categories may have different attributes that make up a variant: for e.g. in frozen category, implement size and weight packaging . Customer facing Requirements mobile UMA and legacy app : Enable items with similar characteristics to be grouped together this will be enabled on the front end with the work done by the Catalog Operations team on the Catalog UI tool Similar items grouped together should be searchable Variants will need to have associated deals coupons available as part of the variant offering in PDP Ability to nominate a variant as primary variant. This decision should be made based on highest sales within a group of items if vanilla ice cream is the bestseller, vanilla ice cream should be the primary variant. This variant will also be need to be replaced by another variant when primary variant is OOS. For e.g. if vanilla ice cream is OOS, nominate strawberry ice cream as the primary variant. Retain the vanilla ice cream as a regular product variant not primary and show that as OOS. Every individual variant should be accompanied with a swatch image that should display additional details when the customer hovers over the swatch image. Every variant should have inventory availability associated with it for e.g. strawberry ice cream can be OOS, whereas the ability to display actual counts or inventory availability for other flavors should be available. A category should have the variant feature implemented for 2 attributes: for e.g. size and flavor . Different categories may have different attributes that make up a variant: for e.g. in frozen category, implement If product variants within a variant group have different prices, those prices should be available on the PDP. PDP behavior should have a collection of swatch images clicking on each swatch image should show the various attributes for that variant: price, inventory, image, deals coupons promotions. A category should have the variant feature implemented for 2 attributes: for e.g. size and flavor . Different categories may have different attributes that make up a variant: for e.g. in frozen category, implement size and weight packaging . Catalog UI Requirements Ability to create variants by grouping BPNs together based on similar characteristics Ability to create a variant group. This tool should have the ability to search for items on several attributes BPN, UPC, SMIC, Description, etc. and provide the list of search results. Multiple BPNs items can be added to a variant group. BPNs can be removed from a variant group. Removing a variant from the variant group will make that item a stand alone item. All additions removals of items from a variant group should be reflected on the website in near real time. Ability to group variants by Banner Division ROG Store. Ability to nominate an item as a primary variant manually unclear if we are able to systematically do this work. If we are not able to do this systematically, this feature should be made available. In any case, this feature is a must have so that human intervention can do a manual override in case the system nominates a variant incorrectly . Ability to change the primary variant manually same rationale as above. Programmatic check to ensure that one variant belongs only to one variant group. Catalog user should not be able to add one variant to more than one variant group. Feature List Solution Details Customer sketches, user flows, and design mockups attached to this epic Epic Type Enabler epic type it falls under, or if Business epic Dependencies: Team Feature Catalog Provide ability to group similar items together as variants. Refer to catalog UI requirements for details. Fulfillment Need to understand if there are fulfillment impacts during architecture review. Mobile Replicate web features in alignment with mobile offering for UMA and legacy app. Cart Checkout Need to understand cart checkout impact during detailed design architecture review. UX Design customer experience UX for both web and mobile UMA and legacy OMS TBD Search and Browse Need to understand search impact during detailed design BR Need to understand if there will be impact for BloomReach during detailed design. Timeline: Tasks Needed Sprint Target Release Date Estimated Completion Date Prior summary description: Catalog: Product Variants replaced by Asset description.

data.title: Enhanced Marketplace Catalog for Uber
data.description: Background: Albertsons works with multiple grocery delivery platforms Instacart, DoorDash, Uber , allowing customers to purchase groceries on their marketplace and have them delivered. As part of this partnership, we provide daily, automated feed of our catalog, so that our assortment is properly displayed on their platforms. Daily catalog feed contains store level assortment for ecomm non ecomm stores. Daily catalog feed contains two files: Item i.e., assortment item details and Promo i.e., Pricing promo info. see attached sample files. OSPI ITEM CSTORES.csv Item, OSPI PROMO CSTORES.csv Pricing promo For ecomm stores, we use Albertsons 1 st party catalog config database of all available based on Data Science store availability prediction items as baseline, and for these items we extract various product attributes from SSIMS and create item and promo files. For non ecomm stores, we use 3 week look back of POS transaction logs for the list of items sold and then extract product attributes for these items to create item and promo files. These item promo files are created at the store level and consolidated at the division level These item and promo files for each division are uploaded to corresponding SFTP sites for our partners to consume. Since same files are provided to all our partners, we do not have flexibility to customize the assortment, product attributes, pricing, and markup. To avoid this and give us more operational flexibility, we want to create custom catalog feeds to each our partners. Catalog Requirements for Uber: Data source: For ecomm enabled stores, extract the data from Catalog Runtime DB Note: We are analyzing the pros and cons of using Catalog Runtime DB as baseline for 3P catalog and we will switch over to DCAT Runtime DB after the analysis is complete. Non Ecomm: extract POS transaction Logs with the ability to customize look back period 21days, 7 days, 1day, etc Attributes columns : Extract the item product attributes from Runtime DB. See existing sample feed for columns attributes. 3PM Catalog Columns SampleData.xlsx Note: For the attributes are not present in 1P, we will continue to extract them from SSIMS data in EDM Remove unused columns : ABS SUPPLIER NUM, ABS UNIT OF MEASURE, ABS PRICE AS CODE, ABS SUBCAT NM, ABS REG RETAIL QTY Note: For now, we will not remove any unused columns attributes New Additional columns : BPN, Brand Name need a mechanism to distinguish Albertsons own brand items from National brands , Department, Group, Category, Class, Subclass, SubSubClass, Sales Rank , Wellness Tags, Avg weight, Purchase Qty Limit where applicable , CRV Volume Based Alcohol Taxes where applicable e.g. stores in WA, IL , Image URLs, Availability inventory Signal Note : We will review the final list with Uber and Add Delete Modify attributes list as needed. For each new attribute to be added, we will create a separate story. Ex: For adding BPN to Door Dash catalog, we will use https: jira.safeway.com browse DCAT 1829 Markup : Need ability to customize markup per partner especially for Alcohol items where partners are not allowed to markup on their own because of regulatory constraints Exclusions Blocks: Need to exclude category of items e.g. Tobacco, Alcohol, Bulk Bakery, Floral, Greeting cards to meet business, operational and regulatory requirements. These exclusions will be managed via Blocked Item List specific to Door Dash h4. New Additional columns : BPN, Brand Name need a mechanism to distinguish Albertsons own brand items from National brands , Department, Group, Category, Class, Subclass, SubSubClass, Sales Rank , Wellness Tags, Avg weight, Purchase Qty Limit where applicable , CRV Volume Based Alcohol Taxes where applicable e.g. stores in WA, IL , Image URLs, Availability inventory Signal Note : We will review the final list with Uber and Add Delete Modify attributes list as needed Markup : Need ability to customize markup per partner especially for Alcohol items where partners are not allowed to markup on their own because of regulatory constraints Exclusions: Need to exclude category of items e.g. Tobacco, Alcohol, Bulk Bakery, Floral, Greeting cards to meet business, operational and regulatory requirments.

data.title: Marketplace Sellers to participate in Albertsons Media Collective AMC
data.description: Target KPI Benefits: 10.5 conversion rate 678K GMV quarter 1M in projected annual ad revenue 2 of AMC digital search ad rev. Challenge Opportunity Albertsons Media Collective will drive 30Mn of ad revenue through on platform ad units in 2022, growing to over 50Mn in 2023. On average, AMC on site advertising drives 5 Mn impressions per day. The Collective runs search ads in positions 2, 4 and 6 highly visible placements that can drive discovery of new products or help customers quickly find what they re looking for. There s an opportunity for Marketplace sellers to reach customers where they are, allowing Multi touchpoints, in the moments that matter the most to the customer in their purchase journey reach customers looking for similar products . Enabling AMC features for Marketplace will provide a visibility boost to sellers and their products, as ads appear in highly visible placements within search results and display banners ads. Further, this feature will enable our selling partners to drive growth using unique actionable insights unlocked via ACI s first party proprietary data . Example Features: Increase awareness and conversion of Products on Marketplace through seller participation in: Seller funded sponsored search on site display ads Seller participation in existing AMC onsite Banner Ads Seller funded contextual product insertion through Onsite Cross Sell tactics Sample Customer journey While shopping for her weekly basket, Tawny searches for Nutrition Granola Bars on ACI app . Among all the search results on the app 1p Marketplace , there is a sponsored search result from Marketplace Seller Elite Commerce , selling a case of 6 of the 24 pack Nature Valley Oats Honey Granola Bar. Since Tawny always keeps snacks in the house for her home office and kids who are always hungry, she is delighted to see that she can buy a big box of snacks while she does her routine grocery shopping. She taps on the item to read reviews, ingredients and other details from the product detail page, and adds the item to cart, and checks out directly from the app.

data.title: Marketplace Rich Content Taxonomy
data.description: Target KPI Benefits: 5.6 conversion rate 328K GMV quarter Halo ACI Benefit: 1P use for parent child relationship, badges, A content, multi homing, and comparison shopping Challenge Opportunity This feature set will enable us to reach 18 of ACI digital customers 9 of ACI 1p ecomm carts are built from PDP page 8.5 are from Category Aisle pages 1 . The ability to have a high quality single product detail page using Parent Child relationship will enable us to have better control on quality and relevancy of content, help customers toggle across variations with ease, enable product price comparison, and drive urgency in decision making using Badges, Customer Seller Reviews, and Comparison Shopping. Enabling rich A content on PDP pages will improve the customer experience with enhanced product listings. Example Features: Parent Child relationship : All variations e.g.: flavors, sizes of Jell O to live on 1 PDP vs multiple individual pages Buy box : Sellers to compete customers can choose which seller to buy from basis price, shipping timelines reviews Reviews Product seller reviews Badges New, Featured or Promoted items A Content : videos, UGC, multiple images, nutrition content Multi homing: Nature Valley Oats Honey Granola Bar being able to live in both Breakfast Cereal and Cookies, Snacks Candy Sample Customer journey My son loves Jell O. As a busy working mom, I can t be hunting the aisles of my local Safeway and reading all the labels to see if Jell O has come out with a new flavor. That s why I love my Safeway app and I am obsessed with their new Marketplace. Safeway has made it easy for me to be the best mom ever. My son, is always the first kid to try the latest Jell O flavors, because Safeway makes it easy for me to find it, purchase it, and eat it. I can go to the Safeway app, go to the buy it again carousel, and click on Jell O. All the Jell O flavors are on one page, it tells me which flavors I have previously purchased, and there is a badge letting me know if any flavors are new to Safeway. Not only has Safeway made the discovery of Jell O easy for me, but my purchasing decision can also be based on what s most important to me, quality and price. Safeway s product page allows me to choose the seller to ship my product who can offer me the best deal, but also by reading their reviews allow me to have peace of mind that my son s Jell O isn t near its expiration date. Their amazing seller reviews, allow me to know if this seller can be trusted. Unified search covered in Feature 2 will help us reach to 57 of shoppers driven through search, Buy it again part of Feature 5 will help us reach another 17 of shoppers

data.title: Marketplace Launch own brands
data.description: Challenge Opportunity Owned Brands current product offering limitations stem from space constraints within an Albertsons store. They are unable to offer their products in multiple sizes, including larger packs, as they will not fit or there is not room on the store shelves. With Owned Brands strong margins, ability to offer savings in larger sizes due to price flexibility, and brand loyalty to brands like O Organics and Signature, launching Owned Brand products on Marketplace will help stand up that one stop shop vision. It will give Albertsons the ability to offer larger sizes online, as well as the ability to reduce a customers store presence by one, ie they no longer need to shop a Costco or Sam s Club. Example Features: Catalog ingestion Owned Brands product data at a case pack level ingested into Marketplacer, ie image, description, attribution, pricing, inventory etc Finance fulfillment set up Process, ship, fulfill, and financially report Owned Brand sales through all reporting channels Contextual Display Less product heavy more operational lift Sample Customer journey Mary and her husband Jim are busy working parents. With two children ranging in ages from 1 to 4, they have a busy household and have limited time to cook, let alone shop for food and supplies. Mary loves DUG and its ability to do her shopping from the comfort of her own home. While adding emergency diapers to her cart as she hasn t had time to go to Costco, she notices the Signature Brand now offers the diapers, wipes, and formula that she purchases when she is in a pinch in larger sizes. Mary has always been a fan of the Signature brand, but a pack of 24 doesn t cut it in her family. That s why monthly Mary goes to Costco to buy that 200 pack of diapers and wipes. But thanks to this new expanded selection of product on the Safeway Marketplace, Mary can spend more time with her family as that special trip to Costco is no longer needed, Safeway s Marketplace has truly become a one stop shop for Mary and her family.

data.title: Marketplace Hybridize Wall Garden
data.description: Target KPI Benefits: 3.1 of ACI traffic to Marketplace 20.9 conversion rate 5.03M GMV quarter Halo Impact: Create endless aisle CX Increase Customer AOV, Upsell Cross sell Description: A true customer focused marketplace for a One Stop Shop solution remains wide open in the industry. Customers want a trusted one stop shop where they can find every item on their list and have the flexibility of getting them when and how they want at a reasonable fulfillment price. This EPIC will enable the following: 1. Extend reach to 65 of ACI customers shopping on digital 57 of all customers shop using Search 8 shop directly from browse pages. By hybridizing the walled garden to show all relevant products regardless of sellers fulfillment method, we can drive visibility across search and browse pages 2. Address an unmet need in the industry for both our existing and new customers Up to 16 of segments say shopping is difficult due to needing to shop multiple stores to get everything, and up to 20 say it s difficult to find specialty items or ingredients. Our MLP follows the Instacart model where customers shopping their list product intent must enter and exit out of each seller storefront seller intent to find items. We can create a unique experience in the market where customers can look for and find every item on their list in the same place without the extra steps, AND allow them to deep dive into shopping seller specific items 3. Unified checkout, fees, and flexibility Online transactions are stressful, asking customers to transact carts one by one on a Marketplace with a wealth of sellers will become increasingly unscalable Etsy has moved over to the unified cart experience Sample Features: Unified search and browse: Find products regardless of seller banner 3P included in 1P category aisles Improved customer navigation: Allow both product intent shopping trips and seller intent shopping trips Unified checkout: Flexibility for customers to check out everything in cart at once, or parts of cart Sample Customer Journey: Ann is a second generation Cantonese immigrant and loves recreating dishes from her childhood. During Thanksgiving, she watched her Mom closely and wrote down the 20 ingredients needed for the Taro Chicken recipe. She wants to recreate this meal for her husband and 2 kids. During her weekly online trip, she logs into Safeway.com and starts searching for items one by one, starting with XiaoXing cooking wine. She sees a couple of results returned, one for local delivery from Ranch99, and one from Elite Commerce via shipping. To save dollars from multiple delivery fees, she adds the cooking wine from Elite Commerce for Shipping since it s free and she won t need it until next week. Curious what Elite Commerce is, she clicks through to their storefront and realizes they carry so many Chinese items she s unfamiliar with and bookmarks the page for later exploration. Ann is focused on her task at hand and is pleasantly surprised she found all 20 items so quickly previously she would ve spent hours going store to store With the time savings, Ann pokes around site to see if she can find little delights to reward her two kids for behaving so well at stressful holiday get togethers. She navigates to the Cookies, Snacks, and Candy department. Here, she finds not only the Swedish Fish her kids love bringing to school every day, but the specific White Rabbit candy her grandmother used to bring whenever she visited from Hong Kong. Delighted to introduce her kids to her own childhood snacks, she adds the White Rabbit candy from Saywee to her cart. She goes to her cart and sees the fresh produce from Safeway she usually orders for pickup, as well as the items ready to ship directly to her door from Elite Commerce and Saywee, all with clear ETAs indicating they ll be ready well before next Sunday s meal prep. She s presented with a Checkout button next to each grouping Pickup, Shipping , so she knows that she can place the Shipping order now and spend more time to review her Pickup order if she wanted to. Available to her as well is Checkout All button on the cart for all orders confident she has everything she needs arriving at the right time, she clicks Checkout All . She then selects a time slot for tomorrow at 6PM so she can swing by Safeway after work to pick up the fresh items. She is also able to confirm one more time that the Saywee and Elite Commerce shipments will arrive on Friday. She confirms the CVV on her credit card and places the order, excited to introduce both a traditional meal and childhood snacks to her family next week.

As part of this partnership, we provide daily, automated feed of our catalog, so that our assortment is properly displayed on their platform. OSPI ITEM CSTORES.csv Item, OSPI PROMO CSTORES.csv Pricing promo For ecomm stores, we use Albertsons 1 st party catalog as baseline and for all allowed available items UPCs BPNs, we extract other attributes and create item and promo file. data.title: Salsify api integration will help solve McCormick issues
data.description: Background: currently, Catalog is integrated with vendors like Syndigo and Salsify for product content and imagery. Both vendors are not at par as they have their limitations eg. Salsify provides only single image, brand name, desc, enhance content and marketing copy. whereas, syndigo provides multiple images, above listed attributes, packaging data and more. Therefore brands that work with salsify may not be getting all the advantage to showcase their product information on our sites. Note: there is a project for 2022 to integrate with Salsify s api Requirement: Explore options to integrate with McCormick as a pilot to pull these images directly from the brand instead of getting it through Syndigo Salsify. Catalog tech team to explore technical feasibility for this ask

Companies can drive 40 more revenue from personalization. data.title: Marketplace Shipping as a Channel
data.description: Target KPI Benefits: 8.5 conversion rate 139k Orders in 2023 3.1M GMV quarter Halo Impact: Nationwide shipping, future Wine, Owned Brand usage Description: A Current ACI architecture and UI is built to enable store based shopping and fulfillment which forces customers into one of three modes in store, pickup, or delivery that: 1. Limits us in enabling and scaling shipping As an example, when a customer selects to shop In Store or Pickup, we have no way of knowing the customers home address until the checkout page, to validate if we can, when we can, and how much it would cost to ship specific items to them. Today we have highly convoluted negative paths to address the potential mismatch in shopping zip code and customer addresses Shipping cannot currently serve a customer that doesn t live near a Delivery enabled store 2. Prevents us from unlocking extended fresh frozen local delivery partners such as Market Wagon and Sayweee Our MLP overrides existing architecture today to be shown on all 3 channels and overrides the existing Delivery channel for transaction and fulfillment by indicating it s a Marketplace item. Our systems will not be able to differentiate between local delivery and shipping in the future without clear delineation This prevents us from onboarding frozen fresh products not carried in our stores today and aligns with the 1P opportunity of expanding the frozen and fresh categories of Pet, Baby, and Ethnic Foods 3. Creates significant customer friction and lowers product visibility While pickup and delivery are mutually exclusive shopping intents, shipping should be incremental to a digital store based trip i.e.. my groceries delivered, and the specific KitchenAid mixer shipped from the warehouse since it s not available in store . Setting up shipping as a channel will enable flexibility in showing relevant products with fulfillment method clarity, promise dates sensitive to warehouse x customer location, and flexibility for shipping speeds similar to how customers can select same day next day flash delivery slots Example Features: Local delivery sellers ability to onboard 3rd party sellers fulfilling through local delivery AND shipping if applicable , this opens the fresh and frozen categories Item level ETA item specific ETA from different warehouses to drive consideration and conversion Shop by fulfillment intent allow customer to search and browse Delivery, Shipping, or Pickup similar to Target Walmart Product card fulfillment clear delineation on product cards of how an item can be fulfilled Add to cart intent flexibility for customers to select how they d like it fulfilled Faster shipping options nested options i.e. ground expedited next day shipping Shipping returns shipping specific return flows and fraud engine Sample Customer Journey: Evan is the father of 5 and pays a little more to have his weekly groceries delivered through the Safeway app since it s easier to curate everyone s wish list, faster than spending 2 hours at the store, and less cumbersome to not have to drive to the store and bring back 20 bags each week. He usually shops on the app without designating how he will get the item this way he can see all the products in one place that can be hand delivered on the same day, and the less urgent items such as bulk and specialty items that can be shipped through Marketplace with no fee He realizes they re almost out of rice and could use a fresh bag. He searches for the 10 pound bag of Sekka Premium Japanese rice he knows Natural Commerce carries and can ship directly to his door. Right from the search page, he finds it and adds it to his cart. He enters a search query for the next item on his list Oi Ocha Green Tea for his boys. He sees right on the product cards within the search results that the single bottle can be delivered through Safeway tomorrow, or he can order the 12 pack shipped or delivered to his door from Saywee. He clicks on the Oi Ocha Green Tea PDP and sees the two different CTAs: Deliver It Earliest 5PM today , and Ship It Next Day Shipping arrives Friday, Dec 1 Ground Shipping Arrives Tuesday, Dec 5 He sees that the fastest shipment method would arrive 3 days from now. He s usually a better planner than this, but he s running behind as his son caught the flu, and needs all his groceries by tomorrow. Since he s pressed on time, he decides to pay a little more for double delivery one from Safeway and one from Saywee, so he can make dinner for his little ones tomorrow. He clicks deliver it on the Green Tea PDP. Realizing the urgency, he unselects shipping from his shopping mode so he can see what is available to arrive today or tomorrow. Since he already started a Saywee delivery cart, he decides to also add Azuki Mochi, and the social media famous Tiger Sugar Boba Milk Ice Cream to cart it s been a rough week . From there, he continues down the rest of his list on Delivery mode and adds each item to his cart. In cart, he reviews all the items grouped by Delivery from Safeway , Delivery from Saywee and Shipped Items and clicks checkout all . He selects the earliest 5PM slot for both Safeway and Saywee so he can leave to pickup his son at soccer practice by 7PM. He also see s that the shipped items will all get here in 3 5 days. With everything looking good, he places the order.

data.title: Tax Flag Expansion
data.description: Starting 1 1 2023, a bill in Colorado took effect which provided an option of removing taxes on essential hygiene products. Counties, districts and cities have the option to apply all or part of the tax exemptions. In SSIMS, all four tax buckets are already being used. To charge the appropriate tax rates at the correct level county, district, city additional tax buckets are required. Due to existing tax bucket limitation in SSIMS, there is a projected 30,000 uncollected tax for every period. The definition of each bucket is really just tax rate 1 , etc. the business doesn t know what will be legislated that will require use of the buckets ... generally it could be called as special tax rates For instance, In July 2022, the State of Illinois waived its portion of the low rate for Grocery Items. Albertson s Companies must reduce the rate in HOST Tax Bucket A by 1 for Grocery Items. The Tax Team can t utilize the current 4 HOST Tax Buckets for the new rate. Therefore, additional Tax Buckets are required for Albertson s Companies to be in compliance. In August 2022, the State of Colorado just passed a Sales Tax Exemption on Essential Hygiene Products. Counties and Cities have the option to opt in or out by December 31, 2022. If they decide to follow the State, additional Tax Buckets are required as well. In addition to the states of Illinois Colorado, the following states potentially will pass the new rate unexpectedly anytime: Arizona, Louisiana, and Virginia. At this moment, the Tax Team only has a workaround for the state of Illinois. Without additional tax buckets for other states, the Albertsons Companies will have to pay the uncollected sales tax out of pocket. Request: The request is to add 12 more tax buckets initially 4 tax buckets in the Host POS, for a total of 8 tax buckets, to match the 8 tax buckets that POS can already handle. Benefits: Help The Albertson s Companies avoid potential fines and penalties for not being compliant IL State Tax Rate because the end customer is supposed to pay this tax. Help the Albertson s Companies to avoid doing accrual on the uncollected tax and pay it out of pocket which is currently estimated between 59,000 and 77,000 each month. Prevent Albertson s Companies get into the potential legal issue for appearing to have a competitive edge by having a lower tax rate on the receipt vs our competitors. IT Impact Analysis: 4 SSIMS tax tables are expected to be updated with additional fields. Any program that uses these tables will need to be recompiled and tested regression , even if there are no code changes to the program. For those programs that will need to be updated, application owners have been asked to provide estimates on the development and testing effort. In addition, if these updated tables sends information to EDM Teradata, EDM TD processes will also need to be evaluated to ensure additional data is also sent to EDM and consumers of the EDM data can also be sent consume these new information. Below two BoDs need enhancement: Business jurisdiction Jurisdiction Facility Tax Business jurisdiction Item Jurisdiction Item Tax Source Producer : DB2 Consumer: EDM, Financial downstream applications and Analytical plus Operational reports Tables that need to be created modified: Columns to be added: Volume of data anticipated: Acceptance criteria : Business Owner Contacts: Karen Marrin Agastya Pandarinath Business Requester: Frank Vasi

data.title: Build ITEM360 view and dashboard
data.description: Background: ITEM360 is a 360 view of products that are sold within Albertsons In Store as well as Online platform to support various applications that range from Retail Operational and Analytical Dashboards, Data Science models, adhoc item information oriented business queries and all the way to Data exchange platform where Albertsons sending critical item related attributes to partners for marketing, catalog syndication, analytics, search, pricing strategy etc to mark a competitive differentiation of the company with other competing retailers . The purpose of this initiative is to build a centralized robust destination to serve those need as a one stop shop for all item related information. This epic is to create holistic ITEM 360 view to provide seamless experiences to drive more revenue with engaging product experiences across diverse channels and marketplaces. Streamline commerce information simplify governance and management of product information to enable faster time to market, satisfying customer experiences and greater productivity. It would also reduce cost and increase performance for the end users. Business Value: To reduce the cost and overhead, ITEM360 will deliver all attributes in a linear fashion by joining one time logic with several tables to put the details into a flat table. Not only cost, but this will increase the performance by at least anticipated percentage TBD . Nonetheless, this For larger product and merchandising program, this ITEM360 will play a key role by supporting the need for item relevant data in a most efficient and optimized way. data.title: United Product Hierarchy in EDM
data.description: United Supermarkets was acquired by Albertsons 10 years ago in 2013. At the time of purchase, United s banners included United Supermarkets, United Express c stores , Amigos and the innovative Market Street format. Following acquisition of the core 20 stores, the United division was expanded materially to include stores from Albertsons Southwest and Southern divisions providing a consolidated presence in West Texas and New Mexico and expanding their banners to include Albertsons and Albertsons Market. United is by far the dominant local brand in these areas and consistently drives innovations which are scaled across Albertsons. United completed over 54M transactions in FY22, yet their data is not visible or considered in: 1 Shopper switching and brand preference models which fuel Merchandising decision making 2 Investor talking points related to the number and growth of HH we serve 3 Critical retention and customer lifetime value modeling and tracking to drive our Ambition of Customers for Life Part A: Build Product hierarchy out of active UPC into a new table in EDM Part B: Provision to update partial information and create an OVERRIDE file to load into the same EDM table. Override information to get precedence over original IRI inbound file While doing so 1. We need to retain original value 2. Add modified value in a seperate column 3. Add a new column as Source and populate it with OVERRIDE for modified line item 4. Audit column to capture date time stamp for OVERRIDE ingestion 5. An Exception table to cover edge cases and negative scenario did I capture right Probably require a bit more details later Questionnaire to be filled out by business and IT: 1. Who has permission to update the file and how we can capture the user and timestamp details: We ll need to work out who the long term owner s would be, Stephanie R. can be that person for now. 2. How frequently this override will occur: The override will be in place indefinitely, how often it is updated appended will vary based on how often new stuff comes in. Really difficult to say at this point 3. What level of modification on an average possible be how many rows or columns : So far business identified three points for modification one and two is an entire family item code United term is classified as one sub class move all of a into b , third is at the upc level where we d assign a upc to a specific subsubclass 4, What is the process of adding hierarchy for new item given the fact it takes 6 wks for IRI to provide us the product hierarchy which might cause a understated reporting: Business recommend we d map it manually when it comes in and then when the IRI hierarchy adds the item we cross check if the override is still needed. Priority: High Business Value ROI : Revenue generation Conservative estimates on the unlock will be a 5 value add to the Omni space, or a minimum of 27M annually. It is NOT a Compliance Legal requirement Producer: United transaction and item dimension table Consumer: EDM, OMNI Internal , Symphony External Volume: History: N A Frequency: Weekly Sample Files Data Attributes: Monitoring requirements: Primary Key: Data Quality requirements: Acceptance Criteria: Albertsons Business Requester: Kathryn Africa Michael Grade Vendor Contact: Business UAT: Joe Cochren LPM Score: MLP 8 Revenue 8 Epic Cat 16 Dev Time 8 40

data.title: SNAP EBT
data.description: Background Safeway banner was approved as a retailer for the USDA s pilot program SNAP EBT Online Purchasing in 2018. In practice, this means offering SNAP EBT and EBT Cash as a digital payment type. For several reasons we attempted but did not succeed in standing SNAP up as a payment type until 2020. The project is divided into two phases. Phase 1 SNAP DUG: This is intended as an interim solution until phase 2. The customer orders groceries online, and select a participating DUG store the customer offering SNAP as a payment tender. The transaction is suspended no payment taken at Place Order and the DUG associate takes payment at the DUG pickup spot using a mobile POS. Phase 2 : full integration with the Acculynk, the USDA s official payment provider to provide full digital payment experience for the customer. This epic focuses on Phase 2, SNAP as a Digital Payment Type SNAP EBT and EBT Cash will be offered as a payment type across all channels: desktop web mobile web tablet and App Only banners with a FNS awarded by USDA , and the banner store is turned on for EBT may offer SNAP EBT and or EBT Cash as payment types Banner must be paired with Host State and pass a two week stabilization period. If no major issues as defined by FNS incurred during stabilization period, the banner may proceed with full deployment of remaining stores within the banner If a SNAP DUG store is migrating to SNAP EBT and or EBT Cash as payment types system will remove SNAP DUG payment type as a payment type for that banner store System must enforce USDA requirements if customer paying with SNAP EBT funds Slot management : Delivery and DUG dates may not exceed seven days from day of placing order If a customer chooses SNAP EBT at checkout the system must recalculate checkout to: Restrict SNAP from paying all fees e.g., bag, subscriptions, etc. SNAP eligible items payed with SNAP are exempt from paying taxes Non government container fees e.g., vendor 2 deposit on milk bottle, etc. Any weighted items must apply the Weight Debit of 10 additional to the weighted price on order for each item s Order Summary must present the SNAP summary and non SNAP summary Each time a customer re allocates and updates dollar amounts applied against SNAP EBT the system must recalculate the order totals New payment method added to Account Payment Methods Customer may add SNAP EBT card at checkout Customer has option to save EBT card during checkout Saved EBT cards are added to the Account Payment Methods on customer s account Placing an order at checkout using SNAP and or EBT Cash Checkout must accept multiple payment types SNAP EBT, EBT Cash and CC and or Debit Card Customer may select combination of EBT only, credit debit card only, or combination of EBT Credit Card If customer selects EBT system will validate with Acculynk card is valid and which account types are active SNAP EBT and or EBT Cash before EBT is enabled as payment type System must allow customer to perform funds balance check on SNAP EBT and EBT Cash accounts System must allow customer to allocate specific dollar amounts to apply for SNAP and or EBT Cash Place Order CTA becomes active when customer allocates funds owed for the order to each available payment method After customer taps Place Order the system secure funds from each payment type If CC debit card chosen as a payment type system will attempt a full authorization on funds specified If SNAP EBT and or EBT Cash chosen as payment type s customer is re directed to Acculynk to perform PIN transaction for each payment type to secure funds Redirect customer to Acculynk site to perform PIN based transactions Fulfillment requirements from SNAP USDA if items paid with SNAP EBT : System must not charge higher price for substituted items System must refund overage charges on weighted items System must not charge more for weighted item whose total exceeds the price of the total of item weight debit Refunds to SNAP EBT require using new PINless Refund Functionality Customer initiated refund request Order Cancellations, Order Edits, Self Service Refunds Customer Service ECHO refunds OMS VPOS post pick refunds for Weight Debit refunds and Out of Stock Delivery and or DUG refusals refunds Online items refunded at the store Customer refunds must occur within 2 days of activity Customer must receive notification of refund event. Data points included: Date of transaction Time of transaction if included for other customers Transaction Type Truncated SNAP and or EBT Cash Account Number Transaction Amount Remaining SNAP Balance if applicable Remaining Cash Balance if applicable Order Confirmation Email for SNAP EBT payment type orders must include following: Banner Date of transaction Time of transaction if included for other customers Transaction Type Truncated SNAP and or EBT Cash Account Number Transaction Amount Remaining SNAP Balance Remaining Cash Balance For purchases only: Delivery pickup shipping address Actual or estimated delivery pickup shipping date Actual or estimated delivery pickup time if appropriate Itemized fees for delivery pickup shipping, ordering, convenience, handling or other fees or charges Itemized fees for bags or other delivery pickup shipping containers 8. Order Edit . As a retailer for SNAP we are required to offer SNAP customer post Order Edits if the rest of the customer population is offered this service. Order Edit must include ability to update edit an order and can pay using SNAP and or EBT cash as a tender type 9. Discoverability and Awareness of SNAP. As a retailer I need to ensure we have mechanisms for our customers to search and find out which delivery zip codes and DUG pickup stores are accepting SNAP EBT and EBT Cash as a payment type so that our SNAP customers may use this payment option Update to store finder to include search parameter to include SNAP Online as a search parameter Update eComm services to that system can include SNAP EBT on a store

data.title: Tax Service Integration
data.description: For customers who place eCommerce orders or have transactions in store, the Tax Service integration is a solution that sends transaction details to Vertex 3rd party to calculate accurate taxes and fees unlike our current VPOS and POS solution. Our solution takes into account whether the order is delivery or pickup as well as the tender applied to align with the jurisdiction tax and fee laws. Initial integration will be completed in phases: 1 eCommerce Checkout, 2 eCommerce Fulfillment 3 Retail stores Vertex has additional capabilities that can be added like Tax Exempt Certificates that can be integrated so customers can fill out their appropriate Tax Exempt Certificate form, get it approved, and their orders will be tax exempt.

data.title: Heathy Shopping Integrate Health app shopping experience with Grocery
ACI Rewards Earnings Model
data.description: h2. Goals Capture actions and events from various systems e.g., Health App, Grocery purchases, Dacadoo, Pharmacy that can be used to create business rules for the issuing of Healthy Points. Build an in house earnings model that will give Business stakeholders the ability to configure and manage incentives, using event logic from various systems, that will results in points earning opportunities Allow business users to test or segment certain activities to a subset of users to allow us to 1 test and learn before presenting an earning opportunities to all users and 2 configure earning opportunities that are based on user cohort or segment. Establish and implement logic for points expiration h2. Background and strategic fit For the United MLP, we leveraged Dacadoo s earnings model which allowed the Customer Engagement team to establish how many points are awarded per category e.g., lifestyle, mind, body, and surprise , how many times i.e., slots points are awarded for a specific subcategory and the percentage of points across each category relative to a max points budget. Beyond MLP we want to ensure opportunities to earn points and be rewarded are inclusive of our customers, their lifestyles, health goals and their interactions with ACI as a whole, not just the Health Platform. h2. Assumptions To earn Healthy Points, user must have the Health App downloaded and a Health Pharmacy account created Requires a Grocery Loyalty account. Users will be able to view, claim and clip coupons from the Rewards pages of the Health app. Users can still earn points for completing goals, tracking activities and completing surprise actions as defined in the Dacadoo earnings model.
